title: Data Analyst
company: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago
description: Ann &amp; Robert H. Lurie Children’s Hospital of Chicago provides superior pediatric care in a setting that offers the latest benefits and innovations in medical technology, research and family-friendly design. As the largest pediatric provider in the region with a 140-year legacy of excellence, kids and their families are at the center of all we do. Ann &amp; Robert H. Lurie Children’s Hospital of Chicago is ranked in all 10 specialties by the U.S. News &amp; World Report.<p><br></p><u><strong>Location</strong></u><p><br></p>Simpson Querrey Biomedical Research Center<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>General Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Manages the research data of a multi-year randomized controlled trial, designed to alter developmental origins of disease via reduction of prenatal stress exposure. This position interacts closely with multiple stakeholders within and outside of the study, including the scientific leads, operational sponsors, study participants, and other academic and clinical partners. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated history of working independently with initiative and a strong sense of personal responsibility while maintaining a high standard managing complex data. Responsibilities include: Monitoring multiple systems to assure protocol adherence and data quality. Maintaining research data and preparing reports, preparing data files for analysis, and performing some independent statistical analysis of clinical research data for evaluation / process improvement purposes.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Job Functions:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Manages data capture, archival, curation and documentation for a complex clinical research study.</li><li> Develops and maintains systems for assuring adherence to study protocols and compliance with internal and external policies, standards, rules and regulations.</li><li> Identifies need for and coordinates participant follow up at each stage of the project.</li><li> Continuously ensures data quality and integrity by monitoring and validating study data as it is collected, and by maintaining reliable systems for data governance.</li><li> Maintains active surveillance of study operations to anticipate and proactively avoid fault points and barriers to study progress.</li><li> Performs foundational statistical analysis of clinical research data and works with study statistician to implement more complex statistical analyses as needed.</li><li> Works collaboratively as part of a multi-disciplinary team at Lurie Children’s and Northwestern University with academic and clinical partners as well as study participants.</li><li> Responds to support requests and general questions from study participants regarding data collection equipment, study protocols, research consents, etc.</li><li> Monitors recruitment and documentation of study participants (regulatory binders, source documents, correspondence, etc.). in accordance with study protocols, often working in close collaboration with clinicians and other staff.</li><li> Assists in the identification and recruitment of eligible study subjects, helps arrange study visits and provide instructions to study participants/families.</li><li> Prepares lab kits and requisitions prior to visits.</li><li> Collects specimens from subjects and processes specimens as instructed.</li><li> Promotes clinical research activities within the hospital and the community.</li><li> Other job functions as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelors degre in social or behavioral sciences, physical science, education, nursing or related health field is required. Master’s degree preferred.</li><li> 1-2 years of experience working in a research setting preferred.</li><li> Strong analytical, computational and organizational skills with consistent attention to detail. Strong customer service skills.</li><li> Strong verbal and written communication skills in order to address diverse/large audiences.</li><li> Demonstrated working knowledge of regulatory practices required.</li><li> Proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint, with advanced skills in Excel (or similar) for data curation, analysis and basic visualization.</li><li> Knolwedge of / experience with collecting and manipulating data in REDCap and/or orther data capture software.</li><li> Experience with database or statistical tools such as SQL, R, SASS or SPSS preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>Education</strong></u><p><br></p>Bachelor's Degree: Information Technology (Required)<p><br></p><u><strong>Benefit Statement</strong></u><p><br></p><strong>For full time and part time employees who work 20 or more hours per week we offer a generous benefits package that includes:</strong><p><br></p>Medical, dental and vision insurance<p><br></p>Employer paid group term life and disability<p><br></p>Employer contribution toward Health Savings Account<p><br></p>Flexible Spending Accounts<p><br></p>Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays and Paid Parental Leave<p><br></p>403(b) with a 5% employer match<p><br></p>Various voluntary benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Supplemental Life, AD&amp;D and Disability</li><li>Critical Illness, Accident and Hospital Indemnity coverage</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Student loan servicing and support</li><li>Adoption benefits</li><li>Backup Childcare and Eldercare</li><li>Employee Assistance Program, and other specialized behavioral health services and resources for employees and family members</li><li>Discount on services at Lurie Children’s facilities</li><li>Discount purchasing program</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Lurie Children’s and its affiliates are equal employment opportunity employers. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, order of protection status, protected genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p>Support email: candidatesupport@luriechildrens.org

title: Data Analyst
company: NORC at the University of Chicago
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>NORC at the University of Chicago is seeking a Data Analyst with a quantitative and/or programming background to support a diverse range of research projects in the Methodology and Quantitative Social Sciences department. At NORC, Data Analysts work with our Research Methodologists, Statisticians and Data Scientists and perform tasks such as importing, cleaning, transforming, analyzing, or validating data. They may also support the presentation of data by developing charts, graphs, and tables. The Data Analyst is expected to work collaboratively in a team environment.<p><br></p>Qualified applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. We regret that we are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this position .<p><br></p><strong>DEPARTMENT: Methodology and Quantitative Social Sciences</strong><p><br></p>The Methodology and Quantitative Social Sciences department implements state-of-the-art methodologies and develops innovations to deliver reliable data and rigorous analysis to guide critical programmatic, business and policy decisions for NORC clients. The department provides leadership throughout the project lifecycle on study design, data collection, assessment of data quality, quantitative analysis, and dissemination of results. The Methodological and Quantitative Social Sciences department also conducts its own research and is a leader in designing and implementing rigorous, efficient methods for gathering, evaluating, and analyzing data from primary and secondary sources. The department provides expertise and leads NORC strategy on the use of a broad range of methods and techniques, including research and experimental design, recruitment and retention, instrument design and testing, assessing data quality, evaluating measurement properties of new measures, causal inference methods, machine learning, analysis of clustered data, data visualization and use of novel data sources and technologies to improve data gathering. The department collaborates all other NORC departments and particularly with the Statistics and Data Science Department.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with methodologists and subject matter experts to implement and improve data management activities.</li><li>Developing programs and scripts for data transformation, integration, or reduction.</li><li>Support activities of team members to collect and identify useful primary and secondary data.</li><li>Implement plans for multivariate analyses.</li><li>Implements plans to generate reports, graphs, and visual materials to inform decisions.</li><li>Perform various types of analysis involving multiple data sets.</li><li>Contributing to and reviewing existing data management or analysis programs, reports, presentations and other deliverables</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in one of the following fields: statistics, math, data science or computational social science or related field.</li><li>Proficiency with data management, quantitative analysis and modeling, data reduction techniques and data visualization.</li><li>Team-oriented mindset, strong written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Strong foundation in areas of social science, statistics, and data science.</li><li>Coding skills in languages such as SAS, R, Stata, or Python required.</li><li>Additional expertise in areas of machine learning such as natural language processing and supervised/unsupervised modelling desired.</li><li>Strong skills in problem solving and quantitative analysis are required. Able to organize and prioritize work assignments to meet project needs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Do</u></strong><p><br></p>NORC at the University of Chicago is an objective, non-partisan research institution that delivers reliable data and rigorous analysis to guide critical programmatic, business, and policy decisions. Since 1941, our teams have conducted groundbreaking studies, created and applied innovative methods and tools, and advanced principles of scientific integrity and collaboration. Today, government, corporate, and nonprofit clients around the world partner with us to transform increasingly complex information into useful knowledge.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who We Are</u></strong><p><br></p>For over 75 years, NORC has evolved in many ways, moving the needle with research methods, technical applications and groundbreaking research findings. But our tradition of excellence, passion for innovation, and commitment to collegiality have remained constant components of who we are as a brand, and who each of us is as a member of the NORC team. With world-class benefits, a business casual environment, and an emphasis on continuous learning, NORC is a place where people join for the stellar research and analysis work for which we’re known, and stay for the relationships they form with their colleagues who take pride in the impact their work is making on a global scale.<p><br></p><strong><u>Eeo Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>NORC is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer that values and actively seeks diversity in the workforce. NORC evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and other legally- protected characteristics.<p><br></p>,<p><br></p>

title: Data Science, Analyst
description: <strong><u>Department</u></strong><p><br></p>BSD NEU - Research<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The Department of Neurology at The University of Chicago Medical Center has a great history and tradition, having made significant contributions to neurological training, clinical care, and the basic understanding of neurological disease.<p><br></p>This at-will position is wholly or partially funded by contractual grant funding which is renewed under provisions set by the grantor of the contract. Employment will be contingent upon the continued receipt of these grant funds and satisfactory job performance.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Under direct supervision, this job performs a broad range of operational activities, which may include collecting, organizing, and analyzing information from the University's various internal data systems as well as from external sources. This job also performs assignments related to data manipulation, statistical applications, programming, analysis and modeling.<p><br></p>This job performs a broad range of operational activities, which may include collecting, organizing, visualizing, and analyzing research data. This job also performs assignments related to data manipulation, statistical applications, programming, analysis and modeling.<p><br></p>This will involve implementing state of the art methodologies for imaging and data analysis. The individual may participate in publications and presentations resulting from the work.<p><br></p>Successful candidates will have a degree in computer science/engineering, biomedical engineering, neuroscience, or a related field. A successful applicant will be proficient in programming (Python or related language); have experience with REDCap; be familiar with scientific-computing such as NumPy, SciPy, and Pandas and neuroimaging libraries such as FreeSurfer, FSL, AFNI, SPM; have the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary collaborative environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Performs various aspects of clinical research analysis and data management.</li><li>Assists in analyzing data for the purpose of extracting applicable information. Performs research projects that provide analysis for a number of programs and initiatives.</li><li>May assist staff or faculty members with data manipulation, statistical applications, programming, analysis and modeling on a scheduled or ad-hoc basis.</li><li>Collects, organizes, and may analyze information from the University's various internal data systems as well as from external sources.</li><li>Maintains and analyzes statistical models using general knowledge of best practices in machine learning and statistical inference. Performs maintenance on large and complex research and administrative datasets. Responds to requests and engages other IT resources as needed.</li><li>Performs other related work as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></u><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through &lt; 2 years of work experience in a related job discipline.<br><li><br></li><strong><u>Certifications<br><br></u></strong><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong><u>Education<br></u></strong><ul><li> Degree in related field.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Application Documents<br></u></strong><ul><li>Resume (required)</li><li>Cover Letter (preferred)<br></li></ul>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<br><br><strong><u>Job Family<br><br></u></strong>Research<br><br><u><strong>Role Impact<br><br></strong></u>Individual Contributor<br><br><strong><u>FLSA Status<br><br></u></strong>Non-Exempt<br><br><strong><u>Pay Frequency<br><br></u></strong>Biweekly<br><br><strong><u>Scheduled</u></strong><strong><u> Weekly Hours<br><br></u></strong>40<br><br><strong><u>Benefits Eligible<br><br></u></strong>Yes<br><br><strong><u>Drug Test Required<br><br></u></strong>No<br><br><strong><u>Health Screen Required<br><br></u></strong>No<br><br><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required<br><br></u></strong>No<br><br><strong><u>Posting Statement<br><br></u></strong>Employees must comply with the University’s COVID-19 vaccination requirements. More information about the requirements can be found on the University of Chicago Vaccination GoForward.<br><br>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<br><br>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<br><br>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<br><br>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<br><br>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<br><br>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Data Governance Analyst supports ongoing critical data identification and definition activities. The incumbent will be responsible for two critical functions: 1) use independent judgement to identify, anticipate and oversee identification of data that is critical to strategic business objectives and 2) execution of data policy and standard requirements for identified critical data elements in partnership with lines of business and functional groups. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Business Unit Description</strong><p><br></p>The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.<p><br></p>Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes</li><li>Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost</li><li>Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze reporting outputs to trace metrics back to underlying data components and sources to facilitate critical data identification and classification discussions with business Subject Matter Experts</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and technology to define critical data including business, technical and operational metadata attributes</li><li>Monitoring, measuring and taking action to address data quality within the US Data Catalog by incorporating and understanding information from a variety of sources to recommend a course of action</li><li>Escalating, managing and reporting critical data identification and definition issues with transparency, as well as effectively creating accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards</li><li>Be informed and engaged as a subject matter expert on data-related regulatory requirements, organizational policies and standards, as well as industry best practices</li><li>Provide appropriate guidance, education, training, and communication to all relevant stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of related work experience in Data Governance</li><li>Broad and comprehensive knowledge and understanding of banking operations and data governance concepts (DCAM preferred) </li><li>Disciplined self-starter with strong analytical, logical, reasoning and problem-solving skills</li><li>Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings</li><li>Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint</li><li>Ability to work flexibly in a team environment</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Data Analysis, Data Governance, Data Management, Facilitation, Microsoft Power BI, Prioritization, Problem Solving, Project Management, Working Independently

title: Data Engineer
description: Compass Corporate<p><br></p>At E15, we are the spark that ignites. Our team delivers next-generation insights based on data, not hunches, to drive business in healthcare, campus, corporate, sports, entertainment, hospitality, and retail industries to help companies make forward-looking decisions to benefit their business and their guests. For more information on what we are about as a company, check us out by following the link below: www.e15group.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>We're looking for a hands-on, collaborative Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. When you get out of bed in the morning, you look forward to building solutions, you love working with data, and you enjoy working as a team.<p><br></p>In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make code decisions and build cloud infrastructure and pipelines that will deliver data solutions to our Food, Beverage and Sports industry clients. You will help bring best practices to the team while working with a team of Data Engineers.<p><br></p>We are primarily using DBT and Snowflake. We are also a Python and AWS focused team, using a tech stack of: Python, Spark, Docker, Airflow, and a range of AWS services like SQS, SNS, S3, Redshift, Glue.<p><br></p>If you have a git repository, we'd be excited to see it!<p><br></p><strong>Core Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with our reporting, analytics, and data science teams to understand data sources and business requirements </li><li>Gather, clean, enrich, and transform data to feed internal and external client needs </li><li>Define, build, test, and implement data pipelines, batch, and streaming </li><li>Work within a collaborative team, adhering to Agile best practices, documentation, and knowledge sharing </li><li>Managing personal work output via ADO/Confluence </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with DBT (Database Built Tool)</li><li>Proficient in SQL</li><li>2+ years of hands on Python backend or Data Engineering Experience </li><li>Excellent written and verbal communicator </li><li>Data validation and testing</li><li>Attention to detail</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in DevOps and CI/CD technologies and methodologies </li><li>Experience with Snowflake data platform is valued </li><li>Experience with AWS Cloud Infrastructure is valued </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Apply to E15 today!</strong><p><br></p>E15 is a member of Compass Group USA<p><br></p><strong>Click Here To Learn More About The Compass Story</strong><p><br></p><strong>Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with a criminal history (including relevant driving history), in a manner consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York Fair Chance Act. We encourage applicants with a criminal history (and driving history) to apply.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Associates at E15</strong><strong>are offered many fantastic benefits.</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Medical </li><li> Dental </li><li> Vision </li><li> Life Insurance/ AD </li><li> Disability Insurance </li><li> Retirement Plan </li><li> Paid Time Off </li><li> Holiday Time Off (varies by site/state) </li><li> Associate Shopping Program </li><li> Health and Wellness Programs </li><li> Discount Marketplace </li><li> Identity Theft Protection </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> Commuter Benefits </li><li> Employee Assistance Program </li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Req ID: 1197882</strong><p><br></p><strong>Compass Corporate </strong><p><br></p><strong>Joel Riet </strong><p><br></p><strong>[[req_classification]]</strong>

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and troubleshoots data integration solutions with complex data transformations and provides guidance to other team members</li><li>Influences other team members to achieve commitments per guidance from Chapter Leads and actively contributes to agile ceremonies</li><li>Demonstrates strong technical aptitude across data engineering practices:</li><li>Utilizing variety of tools to profile, secure the data in transit and at rest; and to enforce data Governance Controls and Alerting</li><li>Designing advanced SQL queries</li><li>Leveraging metadata-driven framework for solutions</li><li>Developing test scripts for unit and integration testing</li><li>Develops test methodologies for specific products</li><li>Leads code review sessions and other process and operational improvement initiatives</li><li>Exhibits fluency with use of supplemental tools and technologies involved in data integration (Unix/Linux, TWS/Control-M or alike, BI stack)</li><li>Works on holistic solutions, driving feature and story delivery (Agile)</li><li>Identifies and effectively communicates upstream and downstream impacts for changes in the data pipeline</li><li>Participates in the on-call rotation for support</li><li>Demonstrates effective and clear communication in team and cross-functional meetings, and lead tech communities</li><li>Builds strong collaborative working relationship both within the team and cross-functionally</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>3+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration/Engineering</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>ETL/ELT Tools (AbInitio, DataStage, Informatica)</li><li>Cloud Tools and Databases (AWS, Snowflake)</li><li>Other programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, etc.)</li><li>Leverage CI/CD framework for data integration, Open Source</li><li>Experience working in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)</li><li>Basic understanding of key infrastructure concepts (data centers as well as cloud hosting platform) to support business data needs</li><li>Experience optimizing SQL both relational and nosql</li><li>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Investigations Analyst
description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to deterring illicit activities, protecting against exploitation by criminals, and complying fully with our legal and regulatory requirements. Being the most trusted brand in the industry is our key priority. We are looking for someone who shares our values, is a team player but can work independently, and who thrives in a dynamic environment. Investigation Analysts handle sensitive and high-risk cases and must maintain the highest ethical standards. Our Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) Officer manages the Investigations Team. .<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Conduct compliance reviews and analysis in support of Coinbase’s BSA/AML and other regulatory compliance policies and programs including investigating transaction monitoring program alerts, reviewing transaction and user activity, conducting research, and determining whether activity is suspicious and reportable to FinCEN in a Suspicious Activity Report (including ensuring compliance with SAR requirements, e.g., filing SARs no later than 30 calendar days from the date of the initial detection of facts that may constitute a basis for filing a SAR, maintaining confidentiality -- not disclosing the SAR itself or the existence of the SAR to any persons involved in the transaction, outside of Coinbase, or any unauthorized person at Coinbase, etc.). </li><li>Respond to ad-hoc AML requests, escalate issues, incorporate feedback from manager review or quality control, assist with SAR preparation and filing, identify opportunities to improve processes and tools for greater efficiency. </li><li>Remain current with industry standards and developments in the areas of BSA/AML, KYC and OFAC, and apply regulatory requirements (e.g., BSA, 4MLD, CDD Rule, Sanctions, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.) and internal policies and procedures to case investigations. </li><li>Maintain detailed documentation to demonstrate compliance with regulations and internal policies and procedures. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent </li><li>Minimum 2 years relevant experience (conducting AML investigations, SAR preparation and filing) </li><li>Working knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and guidelines (e.g., BSA, OFAC, FinCEN guidance) </li><li>Strong interpersonal, analytical, and communications (verbal and written) skills </li><li>Ability to make quick decisions and work in a production-based environment </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cryptocurrency or blockchain experience </li><li>CAMS, CFE or CFCS certification </li><li>Experience with SQL and applications Looker, Redash, or Snowflake </li></ul><p><br></p>P1370979<p><br></p><strong>Pay Transparency Notice:</strong> Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$83,300—$98,000 USD<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.<p><br></p>Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).<p><br></p>Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants<p><br></p>Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined here.
description_json: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to deterring illicit activities, protecting against exploitation by criminals, and complying fully with our legal and regulatory requirements. Being the most trusted brand in the industry is our key priority. We are looking for someone who shares our values, is a team player but can work independently, and who thrives in a dynamic environment. Investigation Analysts handle sensitive and high-risk cases and must maintain the highest ethical standards. title: Business Analytics Data Scientist - Supply Planning
description: <strong>Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Business Analytics Data Scientist - Supply Planning</strong><p><br></p>The following position is open in Illinois, United States.<p><br></p><u><strong>What makes this a great opportunity?</strong></u><p><br></p>We are looking for people who bring something unique to Beam Suntory – themselves. We value differences, and we appreciate what each of us can contribute. We inspire each other, and challenge ourselves to innovate, improve, and advance new ideas and try new things. We create endless opportunities to <em>Unleash Your Spirit</em> every day in a culture that is charged, creative, challenging and fun. As a world leader in premium spirits, Beam Suntory inspires human connections.<p><br></p>Beam Suntory was created in 2014 by combining the work leader in bourbon and the pioneer in Japanese whisky to form a new company with a deep heritage, passion for quality, innovative spirit, and vision of Growing for Good.<p><br></p>Beam Suntory has committed to a 5-stage Global Sales and Operations Planning (S&amp;OP) Process to support the new Brand House Operating model.<p><br></p>This Data Analytics and Data Scientist role on the Global Production Planning team requires a background in Sales &amp; Operations Planning (Integrated Business Planning - IBP) with experience within a Supply Chain functional area. The role includes heavy data analytics married with data scientist skills to support the Global SC key business deliverables and Beam’s S&amp;OP journey. This Data Scientist will be self-motivated and exhibit excellent critical thinking skills, the ability to synthesize complex problems and create solutions. The ideal candidate will have more than just knowledge or data scientist skill sets, as they also have a “can do" and “we over me” mindset to find solutions. This position will collaborate with the Supply Planning Analytics, S&amp;OP CoE and Leadership, Regional S&amp;OP teams, IT, and Commercial in the Business Units across all three global regions to support the data and analytics needs for the implementation of the business transformation programs.<p><br></p><u><strong>Role Responsibilities</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with the Global Production Planning teams to provide analytics and technical solutions support the day-to-day planning processes</li><li>Partner with Global S&amp;OP functional areas (Supply Planning, Commercial, and Fulfillment) to optimize our processes as part of the Global Supply Planning team</li><li>Implement process improvement initiatives that drive improvements to the metrics and streamline the Supply Chain</li><li>Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, optimize processes, and develop automation</li><li>Manage the analytics platform, build capabilities, support global user adoption of analytics and process adherence, develop, and maintain technical documentation, work closely with IT for Data Engineering</li><li>Work closely with the technical community to drive an SAP IBP team of business users globally, allowing for internal problem-solving capabilities, a high degree of end-user acceptance</li><li>Partner with the business to understand the market segmentation strategies and develop visualization, models using machine learning (e.g., classification, clustering, regression) incorporating ABC-XYZ segmentation, and statistical analysis methods such as time-series analysis, statistical inference</li><li>Core participant in the design, build, test, document, and training of technical solutions supporting the core planning Supply Chain processes</li><li>Design and integrate a global Inventory Management strategy to provide end-to end Supply Chain visibility to Deep dive large into demand/supply planning and supply chain data to explain change, develop insights, and provide business recommendations to improve attainment, adherence, inventory management, and other key metrics.</li><li>Support all operational and strategic activities and initiatives for the Global Production Planning team</li><li>Perform exploratory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data, and identify patterns</li><li>Process structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data and apply data cleaning, data imputation and feature engineering methods before developing models </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree or equivalent experience in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics</li><li>3+ years of experience with at least 2+ years of experience in a supply chain discipline with demonstrated end-to-end understanding of Supply Chain interdependencies for a CPG or Spirits company</li><li>Strong problem solving, analytical, written, and verbal communication skills across multiple levels of the organization</li><li>Communications and presenting to multiple levels within the organization</li><li>Experience with S&amp;OP Planning tools like SAP IBP, SAP APO (DP and SNP) highly preferred</li><li>Experience with Google Cloud Platform, SAP HANA strongly preferred</li><li>Strong experience with Python/R, SQL, Power BI, Tableau</li><li>Strong experience with developing visualizations through Tableau or Power BI to deliver solutions to end users</li><li>Demonstrated flexibility in easily moving between strategic thinking and tactical execution</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Beam Suntory is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant’s skills and experience.</em><p><br></p>

title: Developer Associate
description: <strong>Department: </strong>Facilities Mgmt EV<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/78<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting into the Facilities Finance and Administration group, the Developer, Associate joins a team of motivated and driven IT staff. Facilities is looking to a higher a talented individual with a strong desire to learn and develop new skills and work with new technologies. This is a great opportunity to get hands-on industry experience and work with different enterprise systems such as Tririga, OnBase and PeopleSoft Financials. In addition, this role completes maintenance on existing Facilities software products, assists in developing code, tests and debugging new software or making enhancements to existing software, writes programs according to design specifications from senior staff and internal customers and performs basic system integration tasks.<p><br></p>The role will support the department’s mission and values by exhibiting the following: inclusiveness, respect, initiative, collaboration, innovation, and accountability. The incumbent will strive to provide excellent service when performing job responsibilities and will practice safe work procedures and follow safety rules at all times.<p><br></p>Please note: Experience working in a University environment. Experience with support of Operations and/or Project Managers<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Collaborates with user to develop work flow and best practices. </li><li> Assists in all stages of the project, starting from the initial planning stages. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Responds to inquiries via phone, online, in-person, etc. </li><li> Creates and maintains software/process/support documentation. </li><li> Routes more complex requests for features/upgrades/changes to appropriate senior staff/management. </li><li> Participates in team/project meetings. </li><li> Identifies database and software performance issues and makes adjustments. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Assists with design, development, and maintenance. </li><li> Tests and debugs software. </li><li> Writes programs according to specifications from senior staff. </li><li> Codes software applications adhering to designs that support internal business requirements or external user. </li><li> Competes tier 3 troubleshooting. </li><li> Develops reports. </li><li> Prioritizes assigned tasks. </li><li> Opens help tickets with vendors. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>    <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> No experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> .Net </li><li> C# </li><li> CSS </li><li> HTML 5 </li><li> JavaScript </li><li> JQuery </li><li> PL/SQL </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> Database design/data structure </li><li> Problem solving </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent communications skills, both oral and written. </li><li> Excellent organizational and problem solving skills. </li><li> Team Player: ability to build effective collaboration and trust in a team environment. </li><li> Multi-tasking: ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Attention to detail: must be able to manage a project and maintain accuracy while working on tasks. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience working in a University environment </li><li> Experience with support of Operations and/or Project Managers </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with databases </li><li> Experience with Onbase, Work Order Management Systems (IWMS) </li></ul><strong> <strong> Benefits: <br><br></strong>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more. </strong><strong> <strong> Work-Life and Wellness: <br><br></strong>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<br><br>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. </strong><strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.<br><br></em>

OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> No experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> .Net </li><li> C# </li><li> CSS </li><li> HTML 5 </li><li> JavaScript </li><li> JQuery </li><li> PL/SQL </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> Database design/data structure </li><li> Problem solving </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent communications skills, both oral and written. </li><li> Excellent organizational and problem solving skills. </li><li> Team Player: ability to build effective collaboration and trust in a team environment. </li><li> Multi-tasking: ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Attention to detail: must be able to manage a project and maintain accuracy while working on tasks. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience working in a University environment </li><li> Experience with support of Operations and/or Project Managers </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with databases </li><li> Experience with Onbase, Work Order Management Systems (IWMS) </li></ul><strong> <strong> Benefits: <br><br></strong>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more. </strong><strong> <strong> Work-Life and Wellness: <br><br></strong>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<br><br>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. </strong><strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. title: Systems Engineer
description: <strong>Company Overview</strong><p><br></p>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<p><br></p>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<p><br></p>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<p><br></p><strong>Department Overview</strong><p><br></p>Central Systems Engineering (CSE) is comprised of a centralized team of highly skilled Systems, software, and electrical Engineers. CSE’s primary responsibility is to support internal and external customers by providing in-depth, technical, system level issue characterization and resolution for ASTRO25 systems, devices, and applications. CSE is also supporting cloud-based applications, including SmartConnect and Cirrus (next generation of ASTRO). The selected candidate will act as a technical liaison between field service teams (SI and MSSs), the technical teams within Illinois (CMSO, CCSi, Upgrade Operations) and development engineering on a day-to-day basis as well as having exposure to our customers and end users. This position is a hybrid role and thus you can based anywhere in the United States, however, there may be occasions (several a year) for in person meetings or lab work in Schaumburg.<p><br></p>CSE also helps integrate complex features that have been or about to be deployed in the field. These features interact with multiple value streams, applications, and devices. CSE also supports demonstrations for new features with internal teams and customers.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Scope of Responsibilities/Expectations</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Serve as technical focal point and catalyst for the resolution of system and product</li><li>problems in complex communications and information systems. </li><li>Proactively assist with the characterization of system level issues. </li><li>Provide detailed analysis of system level issues. </li><li>Participate/coordinate with the collection of all necessary box and system diagnostics</li><li>Information to quickly solve system level issues. </li><li>Track and document technical issue activities, status, efforts, and costs. </li><li>Some travel, both domestic and international, to customer locations is not expected to exceed 10%. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Knowledge/Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Preferred: Working knowledge of basic services such as voice, data, and security or equivalent. </li><li>Preferred: Knowledge of cloud technologies and applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Bachelor degree in engineering, physics, or computer science.<p><br></p>Travel Requirements<p><br></p>None<p><br></p>Relocation Provided<p><br></p>None<p><br></p>Position Type<p><br></p>New Grad<p><br></p>Referral Payment Plan<p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>EEO Statement</strong></em><p><br></p>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

title: Standard Bus Analyst I
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Positions in this Job Family work closely with Department of Standards and Survey Methods staff and other Joint Commission constituents to understand and fulfill Joint Commission standards data analysis and reporting needs.<br><br>The <strong>Standards Business Analyst I</strong> c ompletes data entry and reporting tasks, helps to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data, assists in preparing technical documentation of manual and automated processes, and p articipates as a member of internal workgroups.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Performs standards data entry tasks, analyzes entries for accuracy and completeness, and works with colleagues to identify missing information. </li><li> P repares ad-hoc reports for various committees, senior management staff, enterprise colleagues, and the field, using SQL queries and SSRS Report Builder. </li><li> Writes basic SQL queries from scratch and modifies existing more complex queries, with accurate results. </li><li> Creates SSRS reports by adding custom code to existing templates. </li><li> Performs quality checks to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and formatting of data entered in the application and all data presented in reports for self and team-members. </li><li> Attends and participates in team meetings related to assigned work. </li><li> Collaborates closely with IT colleagues, following Agile Methodology, regarding enhancements and fixes needed for the database, application, and standardized SSRS Reports, including identification and documentation of issues and participation in user testing. </li><li> Participates in project meetings to understand database and reporting needs for the project. </li><li> Learns and follows policies and procedures and applies best practices in the conduct of work. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Associate degree required, preferably in healthcare-related or technical field; Bachelor’s degree preferred. </li><li> Familiarity with relational databases. Ability to quickly learn and master new applications. </li><li> Ability to follow policies and procedures. </li><li> Ability to analyze and synthesize data. </li><li> Ability to communicate effectively and professionally. </li><li> Ability to write clearly and professionally. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Database Conversion (ETL) Developer
description: One of the largest health insurers in the nation is focused on continuously building an industry-defining, world-class IT capability. Healthcare is forever evolving, especially due to emerging technologies, making this a great experience to add to your resume. Come join their winning team!<p><br></p>This <strong>Contract-to-Hire </strong> role as a <strong>Database Analyst</strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> will be responsible for designing and developing applications, databases and reports based on long-term business strategy including major enhancements to existing functionality and user tools. This is a <strong>Hybrid</strong> role, 3 day onsite, 2 days remote.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop, maintain, and enhance complex databases used for a variety of areas and functions using SQL, VB, VBA, Access, Excel and other software as applicable. </li><li> Work with users to capture and analyze business and data requirements necessary to meet business needs and corporate strategies/goals. </li><li> Write programs, develop and maintain distributed architecture databases for major corporate functions and develop required reporting. </li><li> Evaluate and recommend to management appropriate hardware/software platform upgrades. </li><li> Maintain documentation of all requests, data parameters and reports in an accurate and accessible manner. </li><li> Streamline reporting as much as possible by automating queries, etc. and/or placing reports in production to minimize manual efforts. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree and 5 years experience in areas of information technology and 2 years of relevant database and application development experience. Requires advanced to expert level knowledge and understanding of database and application systems design and interfaces. </li><li> 3 years experience in SQL programming. </li><li> Thorough knowledge of PC windows-based applications, including Excel, Access, and VBA. </li><li> Skills to anticipate additional reporting parameters and confirm requirements as needed. </li><li> Interprets business issues and recommends business solutions. </li><li> Takes initiative to solves complex problems that have a far-reaching impact on the business. </li><li> Works independently with minimal guidance. </li><li> Verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills necessary to work in team environment. </li><li> Organizational skills and experience managing completion of multiple projects. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree with concentration in Business, Math or Computer Science. </li><li> Experience with Tableau and SharePoint. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits: </strong><p><br></p>Solving IT is pleased to offer a rich benefit plan to our W2 employees. We offer five health plan options and a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&amp;D Insurance, and 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT subsidizes the health and dental premium for the employee.<p><br></p>As you continue to develop your skills and experience, Solving IT will work with your changing preferences to match you with rewarding projects. Our unrivaled reputation for quality is demonstrated through our Inavero Best of Staffing award that was won due to the feedback from our own clients and candidates. We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Database Analyst 29353

title: Hybrid Database Analyst 29353
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Position Overview </strong><p><br></p>The Engineer I, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will perform technical analysis to assist in the interconnection process for the different generation projects. Based out of Invenergy’s Chicago office, the Engineer I, Interconnections will also be responsible for assisting in other transmission associated activities and analysis, including interpreting the different market rules as they apply to the interconnection process.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support submission and management of new Generation Interconnection Requests</li><li>Perform power flow analysis and market related evaluations as part of generation and transmission development activities.</li><li>Provide grid, transmission system planning and congestion evaluation, to assist in development activities mainly in NYISO, PJM, ISONE and SERC regions.</li><li>Review utility and ISO transmission expansion plans to identify potential opportunities.</li><li>Review utility interconnection studies (impact, stability and facility).</li><li>Identify areas for new transmission projects based on generation technological shifts and the corresponding impacts it has on grid behavior.</li><li>Utilize regulatory and compliance knowledge to identify and evaluate areas of critical impact for projects in the interconnection pipeline.</li><li>Interpret market rules as they apply to the interconnection study, construction, and operation of generation projects</li><li>Work with regulatory team to provide input on queue reforms and process changes as necessary.</li><li>Develop conceptual design of interconnection facilities and costs. </li><li>Assist in conceptual design of wind farm and solar electrical collection systems (34.5kV), substations (34.5kV – transmission voltage 115kV – 230kV – 345kV), and project owned transmission lines.</li><li>Perform technical diligence for potential M&amp;A projects</li><li>Perform complex Transmission delivery assessments to support Origination and business opportunities for RFPs.</li><li>Coordinate with consultants to prepare system models and perform reliability and economic studies.</li><li>Establish relationships with various technical experts among stakeholders, utilities, RTO/ISOs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS or MS in Electrical Engineering with a focus on power systems</li><li>0-1 year of experience in transmission system planning, compliance and operations including complex power flow, short circuit, and stability studies.</li><li>Proficiency in spreadsheet modeling using Microsoft Excel.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of FERC, NERC standards related to transmission and interconnections, including Open Access Transmission Tariff (OATT) a plus.</li><li>NYISO, PJM, SERC, ISONE experience preferred.</li><li>Experienced in the use one of power flow software such as PSS/E, TARA, PowerWorld, PSLF, or PSCAD similar software package a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<p><br></p>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<p><br></p>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

description: We are currently accepting resumes for a <strong> CIP Applications Engineer</strong> position in Hammond, IN.<p><br></p>This position can be remote but will require orientation time in Hammond, IN<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>" Demonstrated abilities in the area of applications development and support in client-server and/or web-based applications.<p><br></p>" General understanding of application maintenance, development, and change management methodologies.<p><br></p>" Must be proficient in the use of command line and GUI interfaces for personal computers.<p><br></p>" Demonstrated ability to identify, communicate and solve complex problems.<p><br></p>" Strong verbal and written communication skills.<p><br></p>" Full technical knowledge of all phases of applications systems analysis and programming.<p><br></p>" Excellent verbal and written communication skills. <u><strong>Education/Work Experience:</strong></u> Prefer BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent and two or more years of programming experience using C++, HTML, Java, and ColdFusion etc. Experience with Oracle and SQL Server <u><strong>Mental and Physical Requirements:</strong></u> " Occasional travel, including air travel. " The ability to perform duties effectively under emergency situations. " Must be available to participate in weekly 24x7 on-call rotation. title: CIP Applications Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Positions in this Job Family work closely with Department of Standards and Survey Methods staff and other Joint Commission constituents to understand and fulfill Joint Commission standards data analysis and reporting needs.<br><br>The <strong>Standards Business Analyst II</strong> independently c ompletes data entry and reporting tasks, ensures the accuracy and consistency of data, prepares technical documentation of manual and automated processes, actively p articipates as a member of internal workgroups, and s upports division staff on technical and database issues.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Performs standards data entry tasks, analyzes entries for accuracy and completeness, a nd works with colleagues to identify missing information. Additionally, determines impacts of the data entry to other projects, areas of the database, or standards manuals. </li><li> Prepares ad-hoc reports for various committees, senior management staff, enterprise colleagues, and the field, using SQL queries, SSRS Report Builder, and Power BI. </li><li> Writes moderately complex SQL queries from scratch with accurate results. </li><li> Creates SSRS reports from scratch or by modifying or adding custom code to existing templates. </li><li> Performs quality checks to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and formatting of data entered in the application and all data presented in reports for self and team-members. </li><li> Actively participates in team meetings related to assigned work. </li><li> Participates in project meetings to understand database and reporting needs for the project. In addition, scopes requested work for length, difficulty, and whether process or technical enhancements will be needed; communicates scope to manager and project team to support project planning. </li><li> Collaborates closely with IT colleagues, following Agile Methodology, regarding enhancements and fixes needed for the database, application, and standardized SSRS Reports; including identification and documentation of issues, creation of user stories and acceptance criteria, participation in user testing, development of testing plans, and confirmation that changes were made appropriately in production. </li><li> Applies process knowledge and best practices from one project to the next and discerns when standard protocols apply and when a unique approach may be warranted. Develops standard operating procedures when needed and assists in educating colleagues on the procedures. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li> Associate degree required, preferably in healthcare-related or technical field; Bachelor’s degree preferred. </li><li> Two to four years of work experience. Experience in the following areas is desirable:</li><li> Design, query, and reporting experience with relational databases (Access, SQL) </li><li> Power BI </li><li> SharePoint </li><li> Technical writing </li><li> Process improvement </li><li> Ability to follow policies and procedures, but to discern when standard protocols apply and when a unique approach may be warranted. </li><li> Ability to analyze and synthesize data. </li><li> Ability to communicate effectively and professionally. </li><li> Ability to write clearly and professionally. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.
