title: Standards Bus Analyst II
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Applications Engineer
description: Job Title: Salesforce Developer<p><br></p>Department: I S Corporate Info<p><br></p>Shift: 1st<p><br></p>Specialty: Strategic Planning<p><br></p>Job Number: 2023-2191<p><br></p>Date Posted: 06/14/2023<p><br></p>Position Type: Information Services<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Salesforce Developer<p><br></p>Rush University Medical Center is one of the country's leading medical centers pushing the boundaries of healthcare services with innovative, compassionate, and accountable team members.<p><br></p>The Salesforce Developer position leverages Salesforce to develop workflows, configurations, customizations, and applications. Works with the business to customize/update complex software for computer programs, designs prototype applications, implements and tests source code, troubleshoots software applications and effectively executes the development plan. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Highlights</u></strong><p><br></p>Hybrid Work Opportunity<p><br></p>Rush offers a competitive salary and tuition assistance to invest in your future<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Delivers complex work critical to the organization in an Agile environment.<p><br></p>Develops software applications, workflows, and configurations to meet customer needs.<p><br></p>Creates actionable technical documentation based on gathered business requirements.<p><br></p>Assists with scoping and planning of various CRM related projects and initiatives.<p><br></p>Develops and maintains SFDC Visual Force pages, Apex classes and triggers.<p><br></p>Performs routine administration functions for Salesforce.com.<p><br></p>Creates documentation, including training documentation and manages release notes (Git) environment of similar.<p><br></p>Participates in cross-functional teams that address strategic business issues.<p><br></p>Supports the deployment of changes to production.<p><br></p>Understands and follows through with business requirements during all phases of development.<p><br></p>Transforms design into functionality; tests and maintains layouts and other components to enhance user-experience.<p><br></p>Collaborates with other developers to ensure consistency and quality.<p><br></p>Continuously maintains; tests and troubleshoots issues and problems.<p><br></p>Creates installation, troubleshooting, and end user documentation.<p><br></p>Provides support and follow-up for issues.<p><br></p>Communicates effectively within the RUMC (Rush University Medical Center) organization and all teams.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Qualifications Include</u></strong><p><br></p>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or 3+ years working in an IT related discipline.<p><br></p>Knowledgeable of ITSM, workflow development practices and techniques.<p><br></p>2+ years development working on Salesforce (i.e.: APEX).<p><br></p>2+ years' experience documenting requirements, designing in a Salesforce enterprise environment.<p><br></p>Experience with scrum and other agile based methodology of software development.<p><br></p>Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills.<p><br></p>Analytical, multi-tasking and problem-solving skills.<p><br></p><strong><u>Company Highlights</u></strong><p><br></p>Rush offers a competitive salary, and valuable healthy living benefits including: health, dental and vision to help you maintain and improve your health. Rush also offers several ways to invest in your future.<p><br></p>Rush University Medical Center received five stars in a quality rating system by the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). Rush University Medical Center is the only five-star academic medical center in the Chicago area.<p><br></p>Rush is an academic health system comprising Rush University Medical Center, Rush Copley Medical Center and Rush Oak Park Hospital.<p><br></p>Rush was recently ranked first for Quality and Accountability among US academic medical centers in a study conducted by the health care performance improvement company Vizient.<p><br></p>In U.S. News &amp; World Report's 2019-2020 Best Hospitals issue, Rush ranked among the top 50 hospitals in 5 categories.<p><br></p>Rush is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Salesforce Developer
description: <strong>Requires Secret Clearance<br><br></strong>Designs, develops, troubleshoots, and analyzes computer software. Reviews architecture and selects and integrates appropriate development and support tools to ensure product performance. Investigates, identifies, and resolves code issues logged internally by QA or end users. Develops and maintains documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Works with user groups to solve business problems with available technology including hardware, software, databases, and peripherals.</li><li> Develops and implements processes that enable agile teaming to maximize talent utilization across the customer organization.</li><li> In depth understanding of emerging IT technologies in order to create directorate level business processes</li><li> Partners with various stakeholder organization's to lead planning and business process improvement efforts.</li><li> Establishes needed processes, governance structures, performance metrics and reporting.</li><li> Applies expert functional knowledge and experience to significant business projects or processes.</li><li> Maintains expertise by in-depth involvement in the state-of-the-art research and technology development in the field.</li><li> Monitors and/or participates in industry user forums, working groups in area of expertise.</li><li> As needed, identifies the most qualified internal resources and/or contractor team to assist with tasks. Selects contractors, frames statements of work, and directs the work of the team to assure technical and financial milestones are met.</li><li> May lead a small team of capable technical staff members and advises/mentors developing technical staff, does not have direct management responsibility.</li><li> Coaches and mentors internal staff in associated technical areas of expertise.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in a related field; Master's Degree preferred<br><br>15+ years of experience in a technical field<br><br>Tech Stack/Tool Suite to be used include and which expertise is required<br><ul><li> React 16.11.0</li><li> Bootstrap 4.3.1</li><li> jQuery 1.12.4</li><li> Node.js 10.24.1</li><li> Yarn 1.22.5</li><li> Jest 24.9.0</li><li> Ruby 2.6.8</li><li> Rails 5.1.7</li><li> RubyGems 3.0.3.1</li><li> Rack version 2.2.3</li><li> Rspec 3.10</li><li> MySQL (Rails uses mysql2 gem v0.5.3 as adapter)</li><li> AWS commercial services - SQS, DynamoDB, SNS</li><li> REST APIs</li><li> Angular</li><li> Java</li><li> Python</li><li> Groovy</li><li> Vue v2.0</li><li> Vuetify v1.5</li><li> FeathersJS v6.1</li><li> Sequelize v5.21</li><li> Axios v0.18</li><li> Express.js v4.16</li><li> AWS RDS for PostgreSQL</li><li> AWS Simple Storage Service (S3)</li><li> Docker</li><li> AWS Lambda<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Job Specific Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li> Process oriented, conceptually driven and possess the ability to think strategically and work collaboratively in a highly technical setting.</li><li> Demonstrated success in developing strategic goals and leading complex programs.</li><li> Experience with project development lifecycle and systems operations.</li><li> Proven ability to interact with customers, senior leadership and program managers in a highly matrixed environment.</li><li> Proven ability to develop and extend network of working level contacts to facilitate behind the scenes coordination.</li><li> Proven experience in designing, developing, and delivering executive level communication on organization transformation and business process changes. Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

title: IBM Cognos Developer
description: <p><strong>Senior Mendix Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Chicago, IL</strong></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Position Overview:</p><p>We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Mendix Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate should have over 8 years of experience in the IT industry, with a minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in developing Mendix applications for enterprise customers. The candidate should also possess strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders and team members.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Responsibilities:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Design, develop, and maintain Mendix applications for enterprise customers, ensuring high-quality and scalable solutions.</li><li>Collaborate with business analysts, stakeholders, and project managers to gather requirements, define project scope, and propose technical solutions.</li><li>Translate business requirements into technical specifications and create detailed technical designs.</li><li>Implement best practices for Mendix development, including module structure, microflows, and data modelling.</li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, maintainability, and performance optimization.</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in Mendix applications, working closely with the support team and stakeholders.</li><li>Develop and execute unit tests to ensure the reliability and functionality of developed modules.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including UI/UX designers and backend developers, to deliver integrated solutions.</li><li>Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers, assisting them in their professional growth.</li><li>Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Mendix and related technologies, and apply them to improve development practices.</li><li>Communicate effectively with stakeholders, including clients, project managers, and team members, to gather requirements, provide updates, and address concerns.</li><li>Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Qualifications:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.</li><li>8+ years of overall IT industry experience.</li><li>3+ years of hands-on experience in developing Mendix applications for enterprise customers.</li><li>Strong understanding of Mendix development concepts, including domain models, microflows, and custom widgets.</li><li>Proficiency in Mendix Studio Pro and Mendix Platform, including deployment and testing.</li><li>Experience in integrating Mendix applications with external systems and APIs.</li><li>Solid understanding of software development best practices, including version control, code reviews, and automated testing.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issues.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders and team members.</li><li>Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously.</li><li>Experience working in an Agile development environment is preferred.</li><li><strong>Mendix certification(s) is a plus.</strong></li></ul><li><br></li>

title: OKTA Developer
description: Position Summary:<br><br>Responsible for providing analytical, reporting, and budgeting support to the asset management and operations functions. Assist with all aspects of budgeting and forecasting activities and research, analyze, and make recommendations to ensure attainment of critical financial objectives. Build and manage procedures based on data compilation and analytics. Prepare succinct communications and reports for senior management.<br><br>TECHNICAL/FUNCTIONAL DUTIES:<br><br>The Financial Analyst will facilitate planning, preparation, development, and distribution of operating projections/forecasts on a monthly and/or quarterly basis. Help facilitate and support the annual property budget completion process. As well as adhere to all company policies and procedures to ensure company objectives are met. In addition to federal, state, and local laws to protect the interests of the company. The ideal candidate will assist with updating and maintaining policies related to budget development, Create and enhance budget development tools, Provide analytical support to senior management during budget review process. The Financial Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining the scheduling of long-term portfolio capital projects.<br><br>Asset analysis:<br><br>Review and analyze property performance. Identify material budget variances and gather information to determine root causes. Model specific asset performance through cost/benefit and breakeven analysis.<br><br><br><br>Expense analysis/recommendations: <br><br>Periodically review and compare operating expenses<br>across the portfolio, identify and share best practices. Assist in analyzing and developing solutions for expense issues. Review utility billing key performance indicators, identify, analyze, and seek solutions to billing issues.<br><br><br><br>Reporting: <br><br>Work with information technology department and/or vendors to develop special reports to assist with operational management and decision making. Act as primary liaison for testing and validation of new reports. Ensure that operating reports are timely and accurate.<br><br>BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES:<br><br>Integrity: <br><br>Demonstrate consistency of words and actions; demonstrate sound business ethics; protect confidential information and company interests. Trust and respect: Demonstrate and treat others in an honest and straightforward manner; keep dealings with others confidential; keep word and follow through on commitments. <br><br>Analytical problem solving: <br><br>Use systematic techniques to define problems, options, and solutions; gather information from multiple sources; evaluate alternatives; solve technical or complex problems using logic; exercise judgment in building realistic solutions to problems. <br><br>Communication: <br><br>Clearly express ideas, information, or concerns; present information in a straightforward manner; ask questions to open channels of communication; listen to understand perspective of others. Accuracy: Be thorough and complete when working with, assembling, processing, or providing detailed information; track details even under pressure.<br><br>Responsiveness: <br><br>Take action to meet the needs of others; respond to minimize delays or problems with little to no supervision; have a sense of urgency in following up. Diligence: Persevere in accomplishing tasks, objectives, and goals. Project management: Control and complete projects on time; involve others in planning; clearly define goals and track progress. Teamwork: Relate to others across functional business units to build credibility and rapport; build cooperative relationships. <br><br><br><br>BUSINESS EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:<br><br>1-3 years of experience in accounting, finance, underwriting, data analytics, or similar position. Experience with data and spreadsheet analysis and developing complex spreadsheets. Advanced knowledge of Excel, including the ability to use spreadsheets, graphing, tables, calculations, and automation efficiently to process large quantities of data relevant to business tasks is required. Must be detailed and display initiative and ability to prioritize, organize and coordinate multiple projects simultaneously. Must demonstrate excellent interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills, with ability to interact with senior management. Possess high level of confidentiality. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint, and experienced with web-based applications. Must have current, valid drivers’ license from the state where the office is located before driving a company-owned vehicle or driving personal vehicle on company business. <br><br>Educational requirement: <br><br>Undergraduate degree; accounting or finance preferred. <br><br>WORK ENVIRONMENT: <br><br>This job operates in an office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, telephones, photocopiers/printers/scanners, and filing cabinets. This role offers work from home capability consistent with corporate policy.<br><br>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: <br><br>The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the essential duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, and walk; use hands and fingers, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; talk and listen to hear. The employee will occasionally be required to stoop or bend and reach or lift with hands and arms. The employee must regularly lift and/or move files and open filing cabinets. The employee must occasionally lift or move office products and supplies weighing up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. <br><br>TRAVEL: <br><br>Occasional travel, some of which may be overnight, is required.

title: Financial Analyst
company: Koren Rogers Executive Search/Koren Riley Real Estate & Property Management Staffing
description: <strong>Company Overview</strong><p><br></p>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<p><br></p>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<p><br></p>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<p><br></p><strong>Department Overview</strong><p><br></p>Motorola Solutions creates innovative, mission-critical communication solutions and services that help public safety and commercial customers build safer cities and thriving communities around the world.<p><br></p>The RF Site software engineering department has a mixture of software engineers, product architects, system architects, and test engineers. Our team is focused on the development of both real time embedded and non-real time applications used in our RF site products.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are looking for a self-motivated individual to help move forward the next generation public safety experience, and to work with a team of top experienced professionals to enable mission critical services and solutions.</strong><p><br></p><strong>In this position you will be responsible for driving mission-critical quality in our products. Your tasks will include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Setup and maintenance of lab equipment, including RF sites, routers, servers</li><li>Leading creation and execution of test plans and scripts for project-based, new software rollout in close collaboration with architects and developers</li><li>Triaging software problems prior to production rollouts</li><li>Performing reviews for architectural and design requirements</li><li>Developing test plan/schedule and maintaining test matrix based on development </li><li>Using tools such as Quality Center or Test Rail to track the progress of test case development and execution</li><li>Occasional assignments in software product development using agile methodologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Qualified Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience creating and executing test plans</li><li>Experience developing and maintaining test infrastructure</li><li>Strong knowledge of software development lifecycle, testing methodologies and processes</li><li>Defect detection, debugging and regression skills</li><li>Experience with a high-level programming language and/or scripting </li><li>Aptitude to independently learn new technologies</li><li>Strong organizational, planning and leadership skills </li><li>Comfortable and adaptable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment</li><li>Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with C++, Java or other object oriented languages</li><li>Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. ruby, python, Perl, bash, etc.)</li><li>Knowledge/experience in RF/Telecommunication systems</li><li>Exposure to Agile/DevOps development practices</li><li>Experience with Linux/Unix</li><li>Experience with Git, Jira, Confluence Understanding of real time processing in an embedded environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors (BS) or Master’s (MS) degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science</li><li>U.S. citizen or Permanent Resident</li></ul><p><br></p>Travel Requirements<p><br></p>Relocation Provided<p><br></p>Position Type<p><br></p>Referral Payment Plan<p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>EEO Statement</strong></em><p><br></p>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

title: System Test Engineer
description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.<p><br></p>Adobe Target Developer is a key member of the Strategy &amp; Innovation function in the Technical Product Mgmt. group within CBS Digital Experience.<p><br></p>This resource will use technology components from both Adobe and Azure to bring to bear innovative solutions to business problems. The objective is to quickly prototype &amp; execute timeboxed PoCs with the broader team to demonstrate art of the possible as well as defining the north star strategic vision. The architect will liaise with the wider innovation team, business stakeholders, platform team, EY vendors and partners to collate and assess requirements and drive enterprise solutions.<p><br></p>To be successful in this role you must be someone who…<p><br></p><ul><li>loves creative use of technology, likes experimentation, is not afraid to try and fail fast and learn. </li><li>understands the Adobe Experience Cloud suite of products</li><li>hands-on development experience with AEM 6.x onwards including AEM as a Cloud Service</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with wider technology teams and business to understand functional gaps and gather business needs</li><li>Actively work with Innovation team members for market research and analysis of disruptive and emerging trends</li><li>Assist in MVP definition and carry out required AEM development work – components, templates, services, necessary configurations</li><li>Document findings, learnings and recommendations</li><li>Share knowledge on new technologies, architecture methodologies, standards, leading practices</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge &amp; Skills</strong><ul><li>Analytical, logical approach to problem solving</li><li>Action oriented</li><li>Serial technology experimentalist who loves to tinker</li><li>Java, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, </li><li> Adobe Target</li><ul><li>at.js 2.0 &amp; web SDK</li><li>Integration with wider Experience Cloud (Adobe I/O, Analytics, Experience Platform, AEM &amp; Experience Fragments)</li><li>A/B, Multivariate tests, Experience Targeting, Recommendations and Automated Personalisation</li><li>Visual Experience Composer &amp; SPA &amp; Form Based Experience Composer </li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years in IT environment</li><li>3+ years in AEM development</li><li>Experience of typical web stack - Java, XML JSON, Web Services – REST &amp; Soap, JSP, Servlets, Tags</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Adobe Target</li><li>Integrations with Adobe Experience Cloud solutions such as AEM, Analytics</li><li>Experience of Adobe’s Project Firefly and Adobe Experience Platform highly desirable</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education &amp; Certification Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A degree in Computer Science/Engineering or a related discipline or equivalent work experience</li><li>Adobe certifications in Adobe Target required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p>The advisory below is only for US-based roles. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary range/s.<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $110,200 to $200,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $132,200 to $227,300. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.<p><br></p><ul><li>Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.</li><li>Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.</li><li>Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.</li><li>Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.</li></ul><p><br></p>Please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.<p><br></p>The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.<p><br></p>The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

title: Adobe Target Developer
description: <em>Tegus is the leading market intelligence platform for key decision makers. We power some of the world’s most well-respected institutional investors, corporations, and consultancies through the largest and most comprehensive database of primary and market information. Our products and services enable clients to discover unmatched insights and answers to the most challenging questions they face to help them make better informed decisions.</em><p><br></p>Tegus facilitates extremely valuable calls between our clients and experts. Given the proprietary insights in these conversations, compliance is critical to our business, and a key component of our value add. You’ll be on the front lines, ensuring our policies and procedures are correctly enforced before and after all Tegus calls.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act as a self-starter within a flat, start-up environment, while working closely with a highly collaborative Compliance Team. </li><li>Utilize extensive knowledge of Tegus’ cutting edge Compliance program to detect material nonpublic and confidential information in transcripts, and ensure information is redacted in accordance with internal protocols, applicable laws/regulations, and industry standards.</li><li>Conduct advanced research to determine the extent to which information exists in the public domain. </li><li>Complete due diligence review of each call and document any instances where Tegus sourcing guidelines are not adhered to.</li><li>Work with Tegus Experts to resolve all compliance flags re: material nonpublic information, and personal/identifiable information. </li><li>Stay on top of internal/external communications and operate efficiently in a time-sensitive environment.</li><li>Perform a variety of administrative tasks, including but not limited to, inputting and tracking various types of data on our processes, transcripts, and workflows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-2 years of experience as a paralegal, legal assistant, compliance analyst, or similar is preferred, but not required.</li><li>Acute attention to detail with proofreading, drafting, and investigative/research experience. Ability to effectively prioritize tasks, manage time, and remain highly organized. </li><li>Skilled in project management, and able to execute deadlines within a fast-paced environment. Proficient in working cross-functionally, and thrives in a team environment.</li><li>Coachable, with a willingness to learn and improve. </li><li>Process-oriented and eager to innovate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits &amp; Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans. </li><li>401K plan with an employer match.</li><li>Paid parental leave for all parents.</li><li>All employees are granted equity through our Restricted Stock Units (RSU) Program.</li><li>Unlimited paid vacation, flexible work hours, and 10 observed paid holidays per year.</li><li>Employer funded long-term disability.</li><li>Fantastic culture with regular virtual company-wide events, including cooking classes, yoga, meditation and more.</li><li>Generous employee referral bonus program.</li><li>The opportunity to attend peer-nominated quarterly DEI events.</li><li>Working for a thriving, performance-based company that values promoting from within, career advancement and transparency.</li><li>Work from our state of the art office in the heart of Chicago’s Loop featuring standing desks, nursing parent rooms, gender neutral bathrooms, subsidized gym access, and full amenity floor.</li><li>Commuter benefits &amp; a fully stocked kitchen with rotating snacks and beverages.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Don’t meet every single requirement?</strong> Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Tegus we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<p><br></p><em>Tegus, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Tegus complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Tegus expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.</em><p><br></p><strong>The only @email addresses we use are @</strong> <strong>tegus.co</strong> <strong> or @</strong> <strong>tegus.com</strong> <strong>. If you receive emails from any other domain (including .us), please assume they are fraudulent and let us know by sending an email to fraudreporting@tegus.com</strong>

We power some of the world’s most well-respected institutional investors, corporations, and consultancies through the largest and most comprehensive database of primary and market information. title: Compliance Associate
description: <p>***No Relocation Available***</p><p>***No Sponsorship Available***</p><p> </p><p><strong>About The Role:</strong></p><p>We are seeking a Technology Operations Engineer and our Operations Team is at the intersection of trading, development, and systems administration and plays an integral part of our firm’s success. The team manages the deployments, scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting for multiple trading strategies. We are seeking an individual to help us solve complex problems and improve our processes and tools. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong sense of ownership who can anticipate challenges. Must be open to working a rotating schedule which will include US and Asia shifts.</p><p> </p><p><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></p><ul><li>Monitor the trading system and work to identify and resolve issues</li><li>Identify, diagnose and troubleshoot complex problems to keep trading online</li><li>Work with Risk and Trading desks to understand and facilitate trading requirements</li><li>Manage daily changes and communicate status to the company</li><li>Automate software distribution and deployments for Linux and Windows applications to speed up our application deployments</li><li>Build new tools to manage our system and reduce effort and errors</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>What We’re Looking For:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field</li><li>Financial industry experience is required</li><li>1-3 years of experience using, managing, or developing on Linux systems</li><li>Fluent with Windows and Linux platforms</li><li>Proficient in a scripting language, preferably Python</li><li>Comfortable with distributed version control like Git, Mercurial, or Subversion</li><li>Familiar with configuration management systems like Salt, Puppet, or Chef</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools, such as Solarwinds, Nagios, Cacti, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks with high attention to detail in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Motivated to identify and problem solve issues in a timely manner</li></ul><p> </p>

title: Trading Technologies Operations Engineer
description: <br><strong>Company Description<br></strong>  <br><strong>At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.<br></strong>  <br>We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.<br>  <br>Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.<br>  <br><strong>Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.<br></strong>  <br>We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.<br>  <br>You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.<br>  <br>We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.<br>  <br>We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.<br>  <br>When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.<br>  <br><strong>Job Description<br></strong>  <br><strong>AECOM</strong> has a position opening for an Advanced Power Platform Engineer to support our growing Energy Business Line. For this role, AECOM offers the freedom and flexibility to work remotely and/or be located at a variety of Energy offices located in multiple locations across the United States. This is an excellent career opportunity for an engineer with a strong technical background looking to grow into a project leadership role.<br>  <br>Job Summary<br>  <ul><li>Design, create, and maintain automated processes, dashboards, and data structures which supply them.</li>  <li>Understand what clients need to do with data and work with experts and coworkers to accomplish it.</li>  <li>Query databases and use APIs to obtain data.</li>  <li>Suggest innovative solutions for client requirements.</li>  <li>Initiate contact with mentors and coworkers to work through problems and questions.</li>  <li>Engage with coworkers and clients throughout the US and Canada.</li>  <br></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong>  <br><strong>Minimum Requirements<br></strong>  <ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related degree with relevant coursework or equivalent work experience with 2 years of experience.</li>  <li>Experience designing and building sophisticated dashboards using PowerBI, Tableau, or a competitive product</li>  <li>Experience designing and building tools for process automation solutions using Azure PowerApps and PowerAutomate</li>  <li>Experience with ETL processes at a commercial scale</li>  <li>Due to the nature of the work, U.S. Citizenship is required.</li>  <br></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong>  <ul><li>ArcGIS/ESRI dashboarding experience.</li>  <li>Experience designing SQL Server databases</li>  <br></ul><strong>Additional Information<br></strong>  <ul><li>Please detail two recent Power Platform projects you led in your cover letter</li>  <li>Relocation and sponsorship are not available for this position.</li>  <li>The preferred work location is hybrid home/office. AECOM has offices throughout the United States.</li>  <li>Occasional travel to client meetings is required.</li>  <li>Relocation is not offered for this position</li>  <br></ul>With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.<br>  <br>AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.<br>  <br>As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.<br>  <br>Join us and let’s get started.<br>  <br><strong>ReqID:</strong> J10088977<br>  <br><strong>Business Line:</strong> Environment<br>  <br><strong>Business Group:</strong> DCS<br>  <br><strong>Strategic Business Unit:</strong> East<br>  <br><strong>Career Area:</strong> Information Technology<br>  <br><strong>Work Location Model:</strong> Hybrid<br><br><br>

title: Advanced Power Platform Developer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The System Verification Test Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will lead software engineering projects directly related to CNH’s precision farming products including auto guidance, telemetry, grade control and section and rate control. The duties include leading a team of test engineers to create test scripts to support the system verification team and leading a team of test engineers to define and execute strategies to increase the amount of automatic testing. Leading and developing test strategies for system testing and performing system test execution for each software release cadence with full verification loops of electronic controllers. Creating and maintaining test reports. Interfacing with the electronic component team to gather hardware specifications of electronic controllers, electronic instrument clusters, displays, telematics and other devices on agricultural and construction equipment. Interfacing with system, software, and functional safety teams to gather requirements of electronic controllers for telematics, displays, auto guidance and other devices. Analyzing and evaluating software and system issues to provide technical analysis reporting, create test reports, evaluate defects and communicate test results to stakeholders, ensuring traceability of test cases, test results, and defects to requirements, and maintaining the HIL (Hardware in the Loop) configuration and bench setup. Salary: $142,600 - $218,500/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Master’s degree in Software Engineering, or a directly related field plus three years of automated test system development experience. The three years of experience must include three years of experience with each of the following: 1) leading verification activities including software review and analyses, system testing, hardware and software integration and unit testing; 2) identifying and resolving coding, ATE, integration, debugging, and software issues, using MULTI, Code Composer Studio IDE, Trakis Simulator, and Target; 3) working with hardware teams to resolve hardware issues; and 4) developing, implementing, reporting, and analyzing system test procedures using DOORS, Python, and Target Environment, and other applicable programs.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: System Verification Test Engineer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company. Driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground, which centers on Innovation, Sustainability and Productivity, the Company provides the strategic direction, R&amp;D capabilities, and investments that enable the success of its five core Brands: Case IH, New Holland Agriculture and STEYR, supplying 360° agriculture applications from machines to implements and the digital technologies that enhance them; and CASE and New Holland Construction Equipment delivering a full lineup of construction products that make the industry more productive. Across a history spanning over two centuries, CNH Industrial has always been a pioneer in its sectors and continues to passionately innovate and drive customer efficiency and success, driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 35,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The System Verification Test Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for ensuring the overall form, fit, and function of new or current products when integrated into a single, complete system including vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology. This position will develop test strategies for system testing; perform system test execution for each software release cadence with full verification loops of electronic controllers and create and maintain the test reports; interface with the electronic component team to gather hardware specifications of electronic controllers, electronic instrument clusters, displays, telematics and other devices on agricultural and construction equipment; interface with system, software, and Functional Safety teams to gather requirements of electronic controllers for telematics, displays, auto guidance and other devices; develop robust, flexible, and re-usable test scripting for automated testing; create test reports, defects and communicate test results to stakeholders; ensure traceability of test cases, test results, and defects to requirements; maintain the HIL (Hardware-in-the-loop) configuration and bench setup; support application and system engineering teams with preparation of reports; support Design of Experiments and Design Validation testing; and identify and implement new procedures for process improvements. May telecommute two days per week. Salary: $109,410 - $163,300/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Electronic Engineering or a related field and five years of experience working with embedded software development or automated test system development. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: (1) electronic controller design, including software architecture, electrical circuits, and I/O circuitry for electronic control; (2) software integration testing and module testing; (3) supporting the design of experiments and design validation testing; and (4) HIL equipment including DSPACE or National Instruments.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: System Verification Test Engineer
description: <strong>Title: EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Work location: Onsite (3 days)-Chicago,IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>The EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions for a variety of clients. The ideal candidate will have expertise in EDI X12/EDIFACT standards and experience working with B2B integrations in Oracle SOA. They will also have experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) and the ability to work with complex data mappings and transformations.<p><br></p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, test, and maintain Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</li><li> Develop EDI X12 mapping and document specifications</li><li> Create and configure B2B trading partner agreements in Oracle SOA</li><li> Build and configure SOA composites for data integration</li><li> Develop complex data mappings and transformations in ODI</li><li> Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</li><li> Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field</li><li> At least 5-7 years of experience in developing Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</li><li> Expertise in EDI X12 standards and B2B integrations in Oracle SOA</li><li> Experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI)</li><li> Strong understanding of XML, XSD, XSLT, SOAP, REST, and WSDL</li><li> Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL</li><li> Experience with Agile development methodologies</li><li> Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li> Strong communication and collaboration skills</li></ul>

title: Internet of Things Engineer
description: Our client, a major Financial Services Solutions provider, is seeking a .NET and ETL developer<p><br></p><strong> Location: </strong>Remote<p><br></p><strong> Position Type: </strong>Contract<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop, maintain, test, and troubleshoot data solutions, including Database Development, ETL / Data Migration Development, and Big Data Development.</li><li> Collaborate with technical and non-technical resources to solve issues and develop new functionality.</li><li> Participate in Requirements Gathering and Analysis meetings with Team Members, Internal Customers, and Stakeholders.</li></ul> <strong> Skills &amp; Tools: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Database development and analysis skills (SQL, T-SQL)</li><li> SQL Server 2016 Experience is a plus</li><li> ETL / Data Integration (Redpoint preferred)</li><li> Azure and Cloud Based Technologies</li><li> SQL Azure</li><li> SSIS</li><li> SQL Performance Tuning and Optimization</li><li> Troubleshooting of complex data solutions</li><li> Big Data Technologies including (Azure Data Factory, Spark, NoSQL, Hadoop, HDInsight, Big Data Architecture) a plus THESE ARE ALL NICE TO HAVES</li></ul> <strong> Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or relevant experience.</li><li> 2+ Years development experience with SQL and TSQL using SQL Server 2012 or later.</li><li> 2+ Years development experience using ETL / Data Integration Tools (Redpoint preferred).</li><li> 1+ Years of experience performing Data Analysis / Data Profiling.</li><li> 2+ Years of requirements analysis experience.</li><li> Experience working on large teams a plus.</li><li> Experience with Project Planning and more specifically sprint planning a plus.</li><li> Experience interfacing with internal stakeholders.</li></ul>

title: CIP Applications Engineer
description: <strong>Are you searching for a rewarding experience helping children and families reach their goals and full potential? If you are passionate about improving the lives of children and adolescents on the autism spectrum, apply now! Key Autism is hiring motivated and passionate professionals, both experienced and entry level to join our growing team! We provide an in-depth ABA training to assist with growth and knowledge of the field and providing impeccable services to our families.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are looking for part time Behavior Therapist in Morton Grove!</strong><p><br></p><strong>Hourly payrate is $20 to $26 based on overall experience</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Must Have Experience With Aggressive Behaviors</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Behavior Therapist Job Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide one on one (1:1) in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy</li><li>Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions</li><li>Conduct discrete trials, implement behavior support, and treatment plans</li><li>Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) Supervisor to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy</li><li>Be responsive to the needs and requests of clients, their families and supervisors</li><li>Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work</li><li>Arrive on time and be prepared for therapy sessions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Growth Opportunities In The Field Of ABA</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible Schedules </li><li>Competitive hourly rates, incentive programs, and bonuses</li><li>A Rewarding Career: Helping kids achieve their goals!</li><li>Behavior Therapist New-Hire Skills Training </li><li>Tuition discount with our Partners! </li><li>RBT certification and aspiring BCBA program (Supervision and Mentoring)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Behavior Technician Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Education: High School Diploma or Bachelor's Degree (preferred), or RBT</li><li>Experience: Childcare, healthcare, or mental health</li><li>Dependability: Consistency and reliability s crucial for child's success</li><li>Integrity: You will work in the child's home without constant supervision</li><li>Positivity and Patience: It's all about positive reinforcement and repetition</li><li>Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication in English</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to up to 35lbs. </li><li>Required to perform activities that entail fine and gross motor skills, bend, kneel, and squat, sitting on floor or in a chair, or standing for periods of time. </li><li>Ability to respond quickly in short distance (100 feet) in response to the movement and behaviors of children. </li><li>Willingness and ability to work in both indoor and outdoor settings.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Key Autism provides services to children and adults throughout the states of Massachusetts, Georgia, North Carolina, Florida, Colorado, Illinois, and Texas. Services include programs for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other related conditions. We have been serving families since 2014. At Key we work as compassionate partners with individuals, families, case managers and other professionals to provide the level of support needed to improve the lives of the clients we serve.<p><br></p>At Key Autism Services, all the autism treatment services we provide are guided by a common philosophy about the role of the family in a child's development. We strive to equip both the children and their families with necessary skills for strong, satisfying relationships with one another, because we know that learning happens best when it happens in the context of playful, reciprocal interactions with life partners.<p><br></p>We believe family is the foundation for a child's development. Family is the ever-present guiding force in a child's life from the first breath through all the growing-up years. Family doesn't close for the holidays, go on vacation or call it quits at five o'clock. Family remains a persistent presence on a day-in, day-out basis, through all the seasons of the year, through all the years of childhood.<p><br></p>Our team is committed to helping individuals and their families become self-sufficient and live as independently as their abilities allow. We hire compassionate, highly trained and dedicated individuals who show a passion to contribute their skills to make our client healthier and stronger.<p><br></p><strong><em>Check out more opportunities we have to offer! </em></strong>https://www.keyautismservices.com/careers/

We hire compassionate, highly trained and dedicated individuals who show a passion to contribute their skills to make our client healthier and stronger.<p><br></p><strong><em>Check out more opportunities we have to offer! </em></strong>https://www.keyautismservices.com/careers/

title: Behavioral Health Technician
description: Foxbox Digital is an award-winning digital product agency, headquartered in Chicago. We partner with clients ranging from start-ups to mid-sized businesses and everyone in between to design, develop, and deliver successful digital experiences.<br><br>We're a remote-first team of associates located in the United States and LATAM regions. Our mission is rooted in continuously engaging and assembling tech-enthusiasts together to build our global team.<br><br><strong><u>Summary<br><br></u></strong>The Mobile Engineer is responsible for bringing creativity and agility to make an immediate impact to help Foxbox build beautiful products. This is a collaborative role responsible for developing and maintaining scalable web applications using React and other modern web technology. The Web Engineer is motivated to participate in working closely with team members to positively impact our clients every day writing clear documents, ruthlessly prioritizing, presenting information and data to clients, and explaining what is going on to other team members in different roles.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop and maintain web applications using React as a service. </li><li>Write clean, maintainable, and testable code.</li><li>Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure high-quality product delivery by recommending multiple courses of action, assessing trade-offs, and prioritizing work taking action to solve problems with our clients. </li><li>Participate in code reviews, design reviews, and architecture discussions, actively soliciting feedback in order to improve relationships and capability.</li><li>Create unit tests and perform integration testing to ensure high code quality bringing value to the client experience. </li><li>Optimize mobile applications for performance and scalability. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest web development trends and technology to suggest ways to improve engagement with the client and team members.</li><li>Engages client and internal stakeholders using appropriate communication methods and questioning to achieve desired outcomes. </li><li>Participate in daily and weekly client and project meetings to understand and respond to changing requirements. </li><li>Identifies opportunities to collaborate with other team members across Foxbox.</li><li>Log billable and non-billable hours daily to accurately bill clients for work performed.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Who You are:<br><ul><li>You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>You have 4+ years of experience in developing web applications using React.</li><li>You have a strong understanding of web development principles, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>You have experience with server-side rendering and API integration.</li><li>You have proficiency in version control, such as Git.</li><li>You have the ability to create unit tests and perform integration testing. </li><li>You have strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li><li>Familiarity with agile software development methodologies. </li><li>Experience with Nextjs and Tailwind CSS is a plus.</li><li>Experience working in a professional services or consulting environment is a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Technologies we use:<br><ul><li>Backend: Node.js | Python | NodeJS | Go | Ruby | Java | .Net | Elixir | React Native</li><li>Frontend: Javascript / React.js / Vue.js / React Native</li><li>Mobile: Android / iOS<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Foxbox Digital<br></u></strong><ul><li>We offer continuous training and growth opportunities</li><li>You are part of a multicultural and collaborative team that is constantly growing.</li><li>Don’t be afraid to break things; we encourage risk-takers.</li></ul>Diversity and Inclusion<br><br>Foxbox Digital is an LGBT company certified by the Illinois and National LGBT Chambers of Commerce. We are committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams to continue building the digital revolution.<br><br>Foxbox is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all and team members with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Foxbox are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Foxbox will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Foxbox encourages applicants of all ages.

title: Web Engineer LATAM
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>Ocean Import Coordinator<br><br>Position Overview:<br><br>The Ocean Import Coordinator is primarily responsible for operationally filing entry documents, tracking and updating the movement of ocean freight, and ensuring compliance with import and export clearance regulations.<br><br>Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:<br><ul><li>Tracking, tracing, and updating the status of shipments on a daily basis. </li><li>Work collaboratively with the Traffic Department and Accounting to provide top-notch, timely, and efficient service to customers. </li><li>Monitoring of reports. </li><li>Accurate and timely billing to customers. </li><li>Providing customer service via email and telephone correspondence to address customer questions and concerns. </li><li>Ensure customer needs are consistently met and assist to resolve inquiries</li><li>Expedite clearance and delivery to exceed customer requirements</li><li>Work well in a team environment and assist other peers when needed</li><li>Maintaining good relationships with various vendors such as carriers, truckers, terminals, etc. </li><li>Process and manage import and/or export shipments</li><li>Prepare price quotes on the international freight</li><li>Prepare necessary documents for shipments</li><li>Develop and maintain relationships with customers as well as vendors specifically steamship lines and customs</li><li>Research and resolve operational problems</li><li>Ensure customer needs are consistently met and assist to resolve inquiries</li><li>Additional duties as assigned<br><br></li></ul>Requirements and Qualifications:<br><ul><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Excellent listening and analytical skills</li><li>Ability to prioritize, multitask, organize, and manage time effectively</li><li>Previous experiences in logistics, cargo management, supply chain, customer service, dispatcher, warehouse, logistics specialist, administrative assistant, data entry, transportation, and logistics analyst are preferred<br><br></li></ul>Pay, Benefits and More:<br><ul><li>Competitive compensation package</li><li>Full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), Life insurance, tuition assistance, PTO and MORE!</li><li>Growing company with a performance record that continues to climb!</li><li>Opportunity to drive significant changes in Talent Acquisition with an ability to make an impact across the organization</li><li>Open-door work environment</li><li>High Performance culture with a focus on a growth mindset where continuous improvement is embraced</li><li>Opportunities for advancement!<br><br></li></ul>CJ Logistics America About Statement:<br><br>CJ Logistics America delivers integrated and multimodal logistics services, connecting every corner of the world via air, sea and land. As a lead logistics partner (LLP), third-party logistics provider (3PL) and supply chain consultant, we help customers leverage supply chain management as a competitive advantage, reducing total system costs, transforming business processes, improving service and facilitating growth and change. With a focus on social responsibility and sustainability through growth with customers and communities, we prioritize the wellbeing of the end consumer, our customers and our employees. CJ Logistics America is responsible for the North America region, specializing in solutions for regulated industries such as food and beverage, consumer-packaged goods, healthcare and medical supplies, and tire and automotive.<br><br>CJ Logistics America is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and or/harassment of any type, including but not limited to discrimination and or harassment based upon race, religion, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, pregnancy or relation medical conditions, childbirth, breastfeeding, parental status, veteran and/or military statue, disability (physical or mental) medical condition, genetic information or characteristics, political affiliation, domestic violence survivor status, marital status, or other characteristics prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Additionally, CJ Logistics America participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations.<br><br>Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
