title: Integration Engineer
description: Job Title Digital Reliability Analyst<p><br></p>Location Chicago, Illinois<p><br></p>Duration Long Term Hybrid Role<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Primary Skills html, css, Javascript, ARIA<p><br></p>Understand and apply accessibility guidelines (WCAG, Section 508, ADA, AODA) to United Digital products<p><br></p>Perform manual (an or automated) testing of digital products for compliance with accessibility standards<p><br></p>Be able to describe accessibility issues and recommendations for resolving same in bug reports to developers<p><br></p>Retest products after fixes have been implemented to ensure that issues have been properly addressed<p><br></p>Knowledge of the latest accessibility technologies and trends<p><br></p>Educate team members on accessibility best practices<p><br></p>Advocate for the inclusion of accessibility considerations in all phases of product development<p><br></p>Participate in usability testing to provide insights on how people with accessibility challenges use United products<p><br></p>Assist with the creation of accessibility-related documentation, such as policies, procedures, and user guides<p><br></p>Provide training and awareness sessions on accessibility topics to internal and external audiences<p><br></p>Design and write manual front-end test scripts for assigned workflows to validate design and configuration against defined requirements<p><br></p>Analyze, resolve, and report on testing status, gaps, and issues to leadership during various testing cycles<p><br></p>Build collaborative relationships with internal and external project stakeholders to achieve business objectives related to testing activities, defect investigations, issues, and concerns related to assigned testing and products<p><br></p>Maintain testing documentation and artifacts for each test as proof of validation.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Required<p><br></p>Applicants for the Accessibility Tester role are required to have these qualifications:<p><br></p>Knowledge of digital accessibility and inclusion<p><br></p>Knowledge of regulations related to digital accessibility (e.g., Section 508, ADA, WCAG)<p><br></p>Experience using accessibility evaluation tools and frameworks<p><br></p>Experience using assistive technologies (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText, TalkBack, Speak to Me, axe DevTools)<p><br></p>5 + years of combined related work experience and completed higher education<p><br></p>and some level of Accessbility certification<p><br></p><ul><li>Must be eligible to work without sponsorship</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred</strong><p><br></p>Applicants with the following qualifications will be preferred:<p><br></p>Knowledge of web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript and ARIA)<p><br></p>Professional training in using assistive technologies<p><br></p>Experience conducting usability tests that include participants with accessibility challenges<p><br></p>Has experience using assistive technology working on products or similar products<p><br></p>Experience using automation tools

Skills html, css, Javascript, ARIA<p><br></p>Understand and apply accessibility guidelines (WCAG, Section 508, ADA, AODA) to United Digital products<p><br></p>Perform manual (an or automated) testing of digital products for compliance with accessibility standards<p><br></p>Be able to describe accessibility issues and recommendations for resolving same in bug reports to developers<p><br></p>Retest products after fixes have been implemented to ensure that issues have been properly addressed<p><br></p>Knowledge of the latest accessibility technologies and trends<p><br></p>Educate team members on accessibility best practices<p><br></p>Advocate for the inclusion of accessibility considerations in all phases of product development<p><br></p>Participate in usability testing to provide insights on how people with accessibility challenges use United products<p><br></p>Assist with the creation of accessibility-related documentation, such as policies, procedures, and user guides<p><br></p>Provide training and awareness sessions on accessibility topics to internal and external audiences<p><br></p>Design and write manual front-end test scripts for assigned workflows to validate design and configuration against defined requirements<p><br></p>Analyze, resolve, and report on testing status, gaps, and issues to leadership during various testing cycles<p><br></p>Build collaborative relationships with internal and external project stakeholders to achieve business objectives related to testing activities, defect investigations, issues, and concerns related to assigned testing and products<p><br></p>Maintain testing documentation and artifacts for each test as proof of validation.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Required<p><br></p>Applicants for the Accessibility Tester role are required to have these qualifications:<p><br></p>Knowledge of digital accessibility and inclusion<p><br></p>Knowledge of regulations related to digital accessibility (e.g., Section 508, ADA, WCAG)<p><br></p>Experience using accessibility evaluation tools and frameworks<p><br></p>Experience using assistive technologies (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText, TalkBack, Speak to Me, axe DevTools)<p><br></p>5 + years of combined related work experience and completed higher education<p><br></p>and some level of Accessbility certification<p><br></p><ul><li>Must be eligible to work without sponsorship</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred</strong><p><br></p>Applicants with the following qualifications will be preferred:<p><br></p>Knowledge of web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript and ARIA)<p><br></p>Professional training in using assistive technologies<p><br></p>Experience conducting usability tests that include participants with accessibility challenges<p><br></p>Has experience using assistive technology working on products or similar products<p><br></p>Experience using automation tools

title: Tandem Developer
description: NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.<p><br></p>We are currently seeking a [[Service Desk Analyst ]] to join our team in [[Lemont]], [[Il]], [[US]].<p><br></p><strong>Argonne Service Desk</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Responsibilities Include</strong><p><br></p>Service Desk Analyst’s primary responsibility is to provide end-user Incident &amp; Service Request support via phone, email, chat, and walk up. Support will require in-depth knowledge of PC and Mac Hardware, Desktop &amp; Laptop Operating Systems, enterprise application administration &amp; settings, high level printer familiarity, and networking functionality and support. In addition, intermediate knowledge of end-user applications is also required. Work is managed and tracked through the ServiceNow and measured through Service Levels. The Service Desk Analyst is the principal owner of the service request as well as the customer’s overall satisfaction.<p><br></p><strong>Service Desk Analyst Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Development, document and maintenance of knowledge base for incident resolution and request fulfillment using ServiceNow or equivalent. </li><li>Provide Tier I/II contact and incident resolution to customers with hardware, software, and application problems. </li><li>Create and manage user accounts, schedule video teleconferences, create / maintain program distribution list and provide remote troubleshooting support to customers. </li><li>Installation, maintenance, deployment of enterprise-wide software and assist with fine-tuning system performance. </li><li>Provide input and update to standard operating procedures. </li><li>Participate in organizations change management process. </li><li>Provide excellent customer service. </li><li>Participate in after hour and weekend on-call rotation shifts</li><li>Contribute to the knowledgebase through research of articles, training courses attended on the job learning, etc. </li><li>Provide remote support, including installing and upgrading software, implementing file backups, installing anti-virus software, and configuring systems and applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p>Argonne is a highly complex environment and as such a minimum level of experience for any junior position should be equal to or greater than the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidate shall present minimum skill/qualification level during interview</li><li>3+ years documented IT Service experience in an enterprise environment and a minimum of a bachelor’s degree in a relevant area of study. </li><li>3+ years of progressive experience in the field of Information Technology, Service Desk Support, Provide Tier I/II system administration, contact and incident resolution for hardware, software, and applications. </li><li>Proven ability to use scripting language (BASH, PowerShell, etc.)</li><li>Administrative knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory, Exchange, System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM)</li><li>Experience with Service Desk Incident Management Processes</li><li>Experience with ITSM, Ticket Management, and ITSM tools such as ServiceNow or equivalent</li><li>Proven ability to perform Information Processing and involve a range of hardware/software solutions</li><li>Concentrated, hands-on experience in installing, diagnosing problems and training customers in the use of software and hardware</li><li>Excellent knowledge of technical management, information analysis, and of computer hardware/software systems</li><li> Certifications or experience may be accepted in lieu of college degree. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Qualification:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>IT Certifications: HDI Support Center Analyst, Service Desk, MCITP, MCSA, MCA, RedHat, Linux,</li><li> CompTIA IT related certification or equivalent or ability to attain within 3 months of your hire date </li><li>DoD 8140 Security Certification</li><li>ITIL v4 certification or ability to attain within 3 months of your hire date</li><li>Endpoint security, DNS, DHCP, and IP experience</li><li>Experience with email systems, Networking, VPN</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About NTT DATA Services</strong><p><br></p>NTT DATA Services is a recognized leader in IT and business services, including cloud, data and applications, headquartered in Texas. As part of NTT DATA, a $30 billion trusted global innovator with a combined global reach of over 80 countries, we help clients transform through business and technology consulting, industry and digital solutions, applications development and management, managed edge-to-cloud infrastructure services, BPO, systems integration and global data centers. We are committed to our clients’ long-term success. Visit nttdata.com or LinkedIn to learn more.<p><br></p>NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

title: Digital Reliability Analyst
description: Our technology consulting client seeks a freelance Wordpress Designer/Developer to begin assisting their team immediately!<p><br></p>This is a fully remote opportunity for 40 hours/week for 3 months, with potential to extend.<p><br></p>Wordpress Designer/Developer Role:<p><br></p><ul><li> Work cross-functionally with creative and product teams</li><li> Design, Develop, Maintain WordPress and WooCommerce websites</li><li> Customize and extend Wordpress themes and plugins</li><li> Integrate websites with systems including HubSpot, SharePoint and Microsoft Teams</li><li> Implement SEO optimization and analytics tracking</li><li> Provide technical support and guidance to team members</li><li> Participate in code reviews</li><li> Documentation of technical specifications and requirements</li></ul><p><br></p>This Wordpress Designer/Developer has:<p><br></p><ul><li> Proficiency in WordPress and WooCommerce design and development</li><li> Proficiency in PHP, MySQL, CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript/jQuery</li><li> Intermediate experience with Microsoft Teams, HubSpot and SharePoint development and integrations</li><li> Experience with custom themes and plugins</li></ul><p><br></p>Creative Circle's Freelance Employee benefits package includes eligibility for Minimum Essential Coverage (MEC) medical plan, dental/vision/term life package, discount prescription program, critical illness, accident, tele-behavioral health, and 401(k) plan. Employee Stock Purchase Plan and paid holiday eligibility are based on length and dates of service.<p><br></p>Submit resume (and samples if applicable) to: Marcella.Castillo@jobalert.creativecircle.com<p><br></p>Creative Circle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Creative Circle will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you need a reasonable accommodation in the application process, please contact your Recruiter (the person you'll be interviewing with) or a member of our Human Resources team to make arrangements.

title: SCA Computer Operator III
description: Foxbox Digital is an award-winning digital product agency, headquartered in Chicago. We partner with clients ranging from start-ups to mid-sized businesses and everyone in between to design, develop, and deliver successful digital experiences.<br><br>We're a remote-first team of associates located in the United States and LATAM regions. Our mission is rooted in continuously engaging and assembling tech-enthusiasts together to build our global team.<br><br><strong><u>Summary<br><br></u></strong>The Mobile Engineer is responsible for bringing creativity and agility to make an immediate impact to help Foxbox build beautiful products. This is a collaborative role responsible for developing and maintaining scalable web applications using Next.js, React, TypeScript, and other modern web technology. The Web Engineer is motivated to participate in working closely with team members to positively impact our clients every day writing clear documents, ruthlessly prioritizing, presenting information and data to clients, and explaining what is going on to other team members in different roles.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop and maintain web applications using Next.js, React, and TypeScript as a service. </li><li>Write clean, maintainable, and testable code.</li><li>Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure high-quality product delivery by recommending multiple courses of action, assessing trade-offs, and prioritizing work taking action to solve problems with our clients. </li><li>Participate in code reviews, design reviews, and architecture discussions, actively soliciting feedback in order to improve relationships and capability.</li><li>Create unit tests and perform integration testing to ensure high code quality bringing value to the client experience. </li><li>Optimize mobile applications for performance and scalability. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest web development trends and technology to suggest ways to improve engagement with the client and team members.</li><li>Engages client and internal stakeholders using appropriate communication methods and questioning to achieve desired outcomes. </li><li>Participate in daily and weekly client and project meetings to understand and respond to changing requirements. </li><li>Identifies opportunities to collaborate with other team members across Foxbox.</li><li>Log billable and non-billable hours daily to accurately bill clients for work performed.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Who You are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>You have 4+ years of experience in developing web applications using React.</li><li>You have 2+ years of experience in developing web applications using Next.js and Typescript.</li><li>You have a strong understanding of web development principles, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>You have experience with the Tailwind CSS framework.</li><li>You have experience with server-side rendering and API integration.</li><li>You have proficiency in version control, such as Git.</li><li>You have the ability to create unit tests and perform integration testing. </li><li>You have strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li><li>Familiarity with agile software development methodologies. </li><li>Experience working in a professional services or consulting environment is a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Technologies we use:<br><br>Backend: Node.js | Python | NodeJS | Go | Ruby | Java | .Net | Elixir | React Native<br><br>Frontend: Javascript / React.js / Vue.js / React Native<br><br>Mobile: Android / iOS<br><br><strong><u>Why Foxbox Digital<br><br></u></strong>We offer continuous training and growth opportunities<br><br>You are part of a multicultural and collaborative team that is constantly growing.<br><br>Don’t be afraid to break things; we encourage risk-takers.<br><br>Diversity and Inclusion<br><br>Foxbox Digital is an LGBT company certified by the Illinois and National LGBT Chambers of Commerce. We are committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams to continue building the digital revolution.<br><br>Foxbox is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all and team members with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Foxbox are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Foxbox will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Foxbox encourages applicants of all ages.

title: Wordpress Designer / Developer
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. </li><li>Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles</li><li>Demonstrates project management and administration ability</li><li>Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments</li><li>Demonstrate customer engagement skills</li><li>Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge</li><li>Good verbal communication skills</li><li>Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems</li><li>Ability to work under pressure</li><li>Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members</li><li>Good understanding of project management principles</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications and Certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent</li><li>Project management certification</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role</li><li>Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations</li><li>Good project administration and documentation experience</li><li>Report writing experience</li><li>Basic project management</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Web Engineer Next.JS LATAM
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, title: TS Implementation Engineer (L2)
description: Podium exists to help local businesses win. Using Podium, local businesses can simplify the way they communicate with their customers—from collecting payments to facilitating online reviews to launching marketing campaigns, and much more.<p><br></p>Our work and focus on helping local businesses thrive has been recognized across the industry, including Forbes’ Next Billion Dollar Startups, Forbes’ Cloud 100, the Inc. 5000, and Fast Company’s World’s Most Innovative Companies.<p><br></p>We look for people who are curious, creative and are willing to do the work to be a little better every day. We also embody our company values in all that we do, which always starts with being Customer Obsessed, followed by Be a Founder, Zero Drama, and Enjoy the Ride. Does that sound like you?<p><br></p><strong>Employer: </strong>Podium Corporation, Inc.<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Software Engineer – Payments<p><br></p><strong>Degree Required:</strong> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent foreign education<p><br></p><strong>Academic Discipline(s):</strong> Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or closely related field<p><br></p><strong>Experience Required: </strong>5 years of post -degree progressive experience<p><br></p><strong>Alternate Occupations Accepted:</strong> Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or closely related field<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform hands on software engineering and development activities on Podium’s consumer payments software.</li><li>Build, implement, and scale Podium’s Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) and software infrastructure.</li><li>Engineer and test software code at all stages of the development lifecycle.</li><li>Develop and implement cutting-edge APIs for payments product to improve existing features and functionality.</li><li>Utilize GraphQL and Apollo Client; deploy software and web infrastructure to combine conversational, text-based commerce with in-store hardware.</li><li>Mentor junior engineers and provide code review.</li><li>Assist in establishing coding standards.</li><li>Design back-end, full-stack and machine learning infrastructure.</li><li>Develop algorithms, data structures, and code to enhance product user experience. </li><li> Position may also telecommute from any location in the United States.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of functional, integration and unit testing of software to ensure software quality and reliability.</li><li>Knowledge of Java, JavaScript, Typescript, HTML 5, CSS and JSON.</li><li>Knowledge of designing and building observable, reliable and resilient REST API microservices in a large-scale environment.</li><li>Knowledge of Unix and Linux operating systems.</li><li>Knowledge of designing and writing complex Single Page Applications (SPA) using expertise in user experience (UX) to create efficient user interfaces.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Location:</strong> 1650 W. Digital Drive, Lehi, UT 84043, position may also telecommute from any location in the United States.<p><br></p><strong>Hours of work:</strong> Usually 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday<p><br></p>Applicants interested in applying for this position should send a resume to Matt VanBuhler at matt.vanbuhler@podium.com and reference the above job title. Applicants who fail to provide a resume and pre-screening question responses will not be considered.

title: LAMP Engineer
description: <strong>AEM developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Iselin, NJ/ Chicago, IL/ Nashville, TN/ Ewing, NJ/ Phoenix, AZ/ Louisville, KY/ Irving, TX/ Dallas, TX/ Atlanta, GA</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Technical/Functional Skills: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience on 5+ Years on Adobe experience in supporting custom AEM components, Templates, Dialogues, Widgets and Workflow</li><li> Troubleshooting AEM related issues</li><li> Experience troubleshooting Vue JS and java Springboot</li><li> Knowledge on automating Maven deployments for CI/CD pipeline</li><li> Experience with AEM integration with following Adobe Target, Dynamic Media/Scene7, Adobe Analytics, Aprimo DAM</li><li> Expert in existing applications supporting the business area</li><li> Hands on to triage issues in Adobe AEM Tool and its integration layer.</li><li> Experience in defining Taxonomy based on business specifications and client operations.</li><li> Experience on content tagging, automated tagging, tuning tags, and cleaning tagged data sets.</li><li> Experience with most Image and Video file formats, conversions, advantages and limitations.</li><li> Proficiency in JavaScript and presentation tier dynamics utilizing Rest calls from JavaScript.</li><li> 8+ Java experience with expertise in Java spring boot will be an added advantage.</li><li> Good to have experience on Rest API standards including the API documentation using Swagger UI.</li><li> Should have worked on SVN, GitHub, and Continuous Integration environment like Jenkins.</li><li> Should have Retail domain experience to understand the business requirement.</li><li> Skilled in coordinating with teams of at least 3 offshore members</li><li> Experience in Cloud Technologies will be added Advantage</li></ul>

title: TS Implementation Engineer (L2)
description: <strong>Genesis10 is currently seeking an Application Programmer with our client in the financial industry located in Chicago, IL. This is a 12 + month contract position. </strong><p><br></p><strong> Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Create tools for auto analyzing and improving data management, deliver some of the client-wide initiatives, regulatory reporting, and platform stability initiatives in the data engineering space; these are large, distributed enterprise applications and experience with comparable systems is important </li><li> Drive end-to-end business deliveries by closely working with global counterparts </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Programming experience with Java, C++, or Python. Strong in Object-Oriented programming and design patterns </li><li> Experience in building tools for data management and support assistance as needed </li><li> Ability to work in fast development environment and quickly adapt to the changes </li><li> Experience/Knowledge in Agile development methodology Test Driven Development using JUnit / Eclipse / Ant / Maven Excellent data analysis skills </li><li> Strong problem-solving and analytical skills </li><li> Self-starter who can work well both independently and within a global team </li><li> Excellent communication skills </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Desired skills: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Capital markets business knowledge </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Pay Range: $42.11 - $50.11 </strong><p><br></p><strong> Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position. </strong><p><br></p><strong> If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply! </strong><p><br></p><strong> About Genesis10: </strong><p><br></p>Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.<p><br></p><strong> For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years. </li><li> The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. </li><li> Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.) </li><li> Behavioral Health Platform </li><li> Medical, Dental, Vision </li><li> Health Savings Account </li><li> Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness &amp; Accident) </li><li> Voluntary Term Life Insurance </li><li> 401K </li><li> Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities) </li><li> Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF) </li><li> Remote opportunities available </li></ul><p><br></p>For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.<p><br></p>Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Software Engineer – Payments
description: Foxbox Digital is an award-winning digital product agency, headquartered in Chicago. We partner with clients ranging from start-ups to mid-sized businesses and everyone in between to design, develop, and deliver successful digital experiences.<br><br>We're a remote-first team of associates located in the United States and LATAM regions. Our mission is rooted in continuously engaging and assembling tech-enthusiasts together to build our global team.<br><br><strong><u>Summary<br><br></u></strong>The Mobile Engineer is responsible for bringing creativity and agility to make an immediate impact to help Foxbox build beautiful products. This is a collaborative role responsible for developing and maintaining scalable web applications using Next.js, React, TypeScript, and other modern web technology. The Web Engineer is motivated to participate in working closely with team members to positively impact our clients every day writing clear documents, ruthlessly prioritizing, presenting information and data to clients, and explaining what is going on to other team members in different roles.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop and maintain web applications using Next.js, React, and TypeScript as a service. </li><li>Write clean, maintainable, and testable code.</li><li>Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure high-quality product delivery by recommending multiple courses of action, assessing trade-offs, and prioritizing work taking action to solve problems with our clients. </li><li>Participate in code reviews, design reviews, and architecture discussions, actively soliciting feedback in order to improve relationships and capability.</li><li>Create unit tests and perform integration testing to ensure high code quality bringing value to the client experience. </li><li>Optimize mobile applications for performance and scalability. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest web development trends and technology to suggest ways to improve engagement with the client and team members.</li><li>Engages client and internal stakeholders using appropriate communication methods and questioning to achieve desired outcomes. </li><li>Participate in daily and weekly client and project meetings to understand and respond to changing requirements. </li><li>Identifies opportunities to collaborate with other team members across Foxbox.</li><li>Log billable and non-billable hours daily to accurately bill clients for work performed.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Who You are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>You have 4+ years of experience in developing web applications using React.</li><li>You have 2+ years of experience in developing web applications using Next.js and Typescript.</li><li>You have a strong understanding of web development principles, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>You have experience with the Tailwind CSS framework.</li><li>You have experience with server-side rendering and API integration.</li><li>You have proficiency in version control, such as Git.</li><li>You have the ability to create unit tests and perform integration testing. </li><li>You have strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li><li>Familiarity with agile software development methodologies. </li><li>Experience working in a professional services or consulting environment is a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Technologies we use:<br><br>Backend: Node.js | Python | NodeJS | Go | Ruby | Java | .Net | Elixir | React Native<br><br>Frontend: Javascript / React.js / Vue.js / React Native<br><br>Mobile: Android / iOS<br><br><strong><u>Why Foxbox Digital<br><br></u></strong>We offer continuous training and growth opportunities<br><br>You are part of a multicultural and collaborative team that is constantly growing.<br><br>Don’t be afraid to break things; we encourage risk-takers.<br><br>Diversity and Inclusion<br><br>Foxbox Digital is an LGBT company certified by the Illinois and National LGBT Chambers of Commerce. We are committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams to continue building the digital revolution.<br><br>Foxbox is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all and team members with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Foxbox are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Foxbox will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Foxbox encourages applicants of all ages.
description_json: Foxbox Digital is an award-winning digital product agency, headquartered in Chicago. We partner with clients ranging from start-ups to mid-sized businesses and everyone in between to design, develop, and deliver successful digital experiences.<br><br>We're a remote-first team of associates located in the United States and LATAM regions. Our mission is rooted in continuously engaging and assembling tech-enthusiasts together to build our global team.<br><br><strong><u>Summary<br><br></u></strong>The Mobile Engineer is responsible for bringing creativity and agility to make an immediate impact to help Foxbox build beautiful products. This is a collaborative role responsible for developing and maintaining scalable web applications using Next.js, React, TypeScript, and other modern web technology. The Web Engineer is motivated to participate in working closely with team members to positively impact our clients every day writing clear documents, ruthlessly prioritizing, presenting information and data to clients, and explaining what is going on to other team members in different roles.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop and maintain web applications using Next.js, React, and TypeScript as a service. </li><li>Write clean, maintainable, and testable code.</li><li>Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure high-quality product delivery by recommending multiple courses of action, assessing trade-offs, and prioritizing work taking action to solve problems with our clients. </li><li>Participate in code reviews, design reviews, and architecture discussions, actively soliciting feedback in order to improve relationships and capability.</li><li>Create unit tests and perform integration testing to ensure high code quality bringing value to the client experience. </li><li>Optimize mobile applications for performance and scalability. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest web development trends and technology to suggest ways to improve engagement with the client and team members.</li><li>Engages client and internal stakeholders using appropriate communication methods and questioning to achieve desired outcomes. </li><li>Participate in daily and weekly client and project meetings to understand and respond to changing requirements. </li><li>Identifies opportunities to collaborate with other team members across Foxbox.</li><li>Log billable and non-billable hours daily to accurately bill clients for work performed.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Who You are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>You have 4+ years of experience in developing web applications using React.</li><li>You have 2+ years of experience in developing web applications using Next.js and Typescript.</li><li>You have a strong understanding of web development principles, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>You have experience with the Tailwind CSS framework.</li><li>You have experience with server-side rendering and API integration.</li><li>You have proficiency in version control, such as Git.</li><li>You have the ability to create unit tests and perform integration testing. </li><li>You have strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li><li>Familiarity with agile software development methodologies. </li><li>Experience working in a professional services or consulting environment is a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Technologies we use:<br><br>Backend: Node.js | Python | NodeJS | Go | Ruby | Java | .Net | Elixir | React Native<br><br>Frontend: Javascript / React.js / Vue.js / React Native<br><br>Mobile: Android / iOS<br><br><strong><u>Why Foxbox Digital<br><br></u></strong>We offer continuous training and growth opportunities<br><br>You are part of a multicultural and collaborative team that is constantly growing.<br><br>Don’t be afraid to break things; we encourage risk-takers.<br><br>Diversity and Inclusion<br><br>Foxbox Digital is an LGBT company certified by the Illinois and National LGBT Chambers of Commerce. We are committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams to continue building the digital revolution.<br><br>Foxbox is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all and team members with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Foxbox are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Foxbox will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Foxbox encourages applicants of all ages.

title: AEM developer - Fulltime
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>S&amp;C Electronics, a global leader for power reliability products is looking for a Software Design Engineer. Included in this position is the support of intelligent embedded software devices including microprocessor-based switch and fault interrupting controls. Candidates must have a strong background in design and development of embedded software on custom electronics.<br><br>This position is located in Chicago. In this position, you will report to the Senior Manager – Embedded Firmware.<br><br><strong>The work associated with this position includes, but is not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Design embedded application firmware for microprocessor-based fault interrupting controls.</li><li>Develop embedded C/C++ firmware for low power designs, including hardware device drivers.</li><li>Develop and support PC-based engineer test tools as needed.</li><li>Create, execute, and automate Unit Tests.</li><li>Review and implement product requirements.</li><li>Participate in Agile scrum meetings and peer reviews of source code.</li><li>Investigate new technologies and create design documents as necessary.</li><li>Collaborate with hardware and test engineers to support verification and validation of products at the module level and system level. <br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Being a team player is essential.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Good interpersonal and leadership skills.</li><li>Continuous learner and self-starter.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of programming principles in C/C++ and Python.</li><li>Embedded software development experience.</li><li>Experience with digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers.</li><li>Experience working with and writing drivers for common peripherals and interconnects, such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, DAC, UART, DMA, flash memory.</li><li>Experience with configuration management/process tools: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket/Git.</li><li>Experience with embedded Linux, Zephyr, or other real time operating systems is a plus.</li><li>Familiarity with real-time operation and low power microprocessor modes is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Relevant Experience Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>2-5 years of experience developing embedded C/C++ firmware applications and device drivers for low power designs. <br></li></ul><strong>MAJOR PHYSICAL DEMANDS<br></strong><ul><li>Standing: Occasional standing for work on complete control assemblies.</li><li>Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds.</li><li>Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility.</li><li>Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects.</li><li>Pushing: Infrequent pushing of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Pulling: Infrequent pulling of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Bending: Occasional bending during access to equipment.</li><li>Reaching: Infrequent reaching.</li><li>Handling: Frequent handling of parts or tools.</li><li>Environment: Frequent handling of parts or tools.<br></li></ul><strong>S &amp; C - TOP WORKPLACE<br></strong><ul><li>For 2019, S &amp; C Electric Company was named the 10th-best place to work among large employers in the Chicagoland area by The Chicago Tribune as part of the newspaper's prestigious annual Top Workplaces list.</li><li>For 2020, S &amp; C Electric was named as the 15th-Best Workplace in Chicago Tribune’s 11th Annual Report.</li><li>For 2021, S &amp; C Electric was named Among Top 2021 Workplaces in the United States by Top Workplaces USA, the nation’s most credible employer-recognition program.</li></ul>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>Program all CNC Lathes and CNC Machine Centers to form precision metal parts and components utilizing appropriate shop equipment (CNC mills, lathes, grinders, etc.) in a timely and efficient manner with minimal supervision. Plans numerical control program to control contour path machining of metal parts on automatic machine tools.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li> Uses G-Code and/or software program such as Mastercam to program CNC machines.</li><li> Analyzes drawings, sketches, and design data of part to determine dimension and configuration of cuts, plan sequence of operations, selection/mfg. of cutting tools, fixtures and machine speeds and feed rates to assure efficient use of tools and time.</li><li> Installs collets, bushings, and bar pullers in stock-feeding mechanism, using wrenches and screwdrivers.</li><li> Positions and secures tools in tool holders, verifying positions with gauges and other measuring instruments.</li><li> Computes angular and linear dimensions, radii, and curvatures, and outlines sequence of operations required to machine part.</li><li> Writes instruction sheets and cutter lists to guide setup and operation of machine.</li><li> Writes program of machine instructions in symbolic language to encode direct numerical control database to regulate movement of machine along cutting path.</li><li> Revises program to eliminate instruction errors or omissions, if necessary.</li><li> Observes operation of machine on trial run to prove programmed instructions.</li><li> Perform mechanical tasks including loading and unloading vices, fixtures and parts.</li><li> Establish and set appropriate tool offsets.</li><li> Loads material, starts machine, observes operation, and verifies conformance to specifications of first-run, sample work pieces and in-process parts, using such instruments as fixed gauges, calipers and micrometers.</li><li> Runs machine through cycle, stopping machine and adjusting tool positions and machine controls to allow for such factors as timing, clearance between moving parts, and chip removal.</li><li> Maintain statistical process control charts by reading and recording measurements when required.</li><li> Visually inspect production for burrs, scrapes, rust and other defects.</li><li> Replace worn tools.</li><li> Operates bench grinder or cutter-grinding machine to sharpen tools.</li><li> Sets up machines for other workers; instructs workers and provide information as needed.</li><li> Responsible for maintenance of machine, including but not limited to lubrication and adjustment and repairs of equipment per manufacturer's manual.</li><li> Update data collection system at beginning and end of each task using barcode scanning and basic data entry.</li><li> Maintain organized and clean work area.</li><li> Receive, understand and follow all written and oral instruction.</li><li> Timely completion of all paperwork associated with position including move tags</li><li> Comply with all company policies and procedures including safety and attendance requirements.</li><li> Participate in activities to increase personal skill level, overall departmental processes and product quality.</li><li> Resolve day-to-day issues by working effectively with others and communicating problems with supervisor.</li><li> Maintain meet or exceed rating on all performance evaluations.</li><li> Follow the company safety rules and other job-related instructions and to perform other job-related duties as requested, subject to all applicable state and federal laws.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Skills And Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Minimum of 2 years of trade school, vocational education, work experience, or apprenticeship.</li><li> Ability to use a variety of lathes, drill presses, and equipment including tumblers, air hose, hoists, wrenches, tool-holders, vices, etc.</li><li> Mechanical ability to operate equipment</li><li> Blue print reading skills</li><li> Basic math and English skills for part count, written and verbal work instruction.</li><li> Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify changes in order to alert department lead.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Physical Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Stand, walk, push, pull, reach overhead, and bend to the floor.</li><li> Lift, carry and move up to 50 pounds of parts and/or equipment occasionally throughout the workday.</li><li> Ability to use a variety of milling machines, drill presses, and equipment including tumblers, air hose, hoists, wrenches, tool-holders, vises, etc.</li><li> 20/20 vision with or without correction</li><li> Use of hands 100% of the workday</li><li> Ability to work in shop environment, exposure to high noise levels, moving equipment and machinery; exposure to dust, fumes and mist; exposure to chemicals including oils and cutting fluids.</li><li> Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify changes in order to alert department lead.<br></li></ul>We offer a 401k plan with 4% company match, BlueCross BlueShield Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance, Health Savings Account (HSA), Life Insurance, Short Term Disability Insurance, Attendance Award Program (can earn up to 2-additional PTO days per year by earning perfect attendance), an air conditioned 108,000 sq. foot facility, a great work environment and other benefits.<br><br>EOE

title: CNC Programmer
description: <strong>Role</strong>: Axiom Developer / IT – Application Architect<br><br><strong>Start date</strong>: June<br><br>Contract through April with possibility of FTE conversion<br><br>100% remote or local to Chicago<br><br>Our client, a Chicago based global financial institution, is looking for an Axiom SL Developer to join their team. Exciting opportunity for a candidate who has a strong Axiom background and looking for their next career move.<br><br>The successful candidate will support various projects for the Cash business unit, specifically 2023 GRS NA &amp; GRS EMEA strategic projects. Will play a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects. For example, configure objects and reports in Axiom.<br><br><u><strong>Skills – must haves:</strong></u> <ul><li>AXIOM SL – developer (not tester)</li><ul><li>3 years minimum of Axiom SL controller view development experience </li></ul><li>IT development experience (6-8 years minimum) </li><li>Axiom database maintenance </li><li>Code development – develop data models, data sources, objects </li><li>Change management – will support SAT &amp; UAT &amp; into production, post production support, batch processing, and upgrade patches </li><li>Collaboration skills – Work across different teams (QAs and Business teams) </li><li>Experience configuring regulatory reports </li><li>Communication skills </li><li>Strong references <br><br></li></ul><u><strong>Nice to have:<br></strong></u><ul><li>Work in teams internally and with vendors, in the US and India </li><li>Financial services </li><li>Regulatory Reporting &amp; Data Warehousing </li><li>US regulatory reports knowledge / experience – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc. <br><br></li></ul><em>Heitmeyer Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to minority status, gender, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em>

title: Software Developer in Test
company: UJP LI internal Middleware Test Company
description: <strong>What You'll Do</strong><p><br></p>Primary Duties and Responsibilities: What You’ll Do<p><br></p>The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is responsible for gaining a thorough understanding of the new system to be tested. This individual must learn both the technical side of the system as well as understand what the business user expects. The SDET is responsible to design, develop and maintain new and existing automation frameworks, continued evaluation of test cases for inclusion in test regression, tests coverage and automation of newly implemented functionality, and development of tools to enable acceptance test efficiencies. The SDET will also work closely with Software Developers, Project Management and Customer Support to form and follow quality procedures, standards and specifications ensuring they are met and deliver the highest quality projects in a timely and cost-effective manner.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each primary duty satisfactorily.<p><br></p>Primary Duties and Responsibilities:<p><br></p>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each primary duty satisfactorily.<p><br></p>Specific duties and responsibilities include creating, maintaining and executing automation test plans, writing code against software platforms, estimating testing efforts, analyzing and communicating test results, defect tracking and participation in day to day acceptance test activities, and contribute to the company’s performance and scalability testing efforts.<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborating with others to deliver complex projects which may involve multiple systems</li><li>Continuously thinking about the next steps while improving yourself and others around you</li><li>Contribute to our long-term vision and strategy for improved quality via automation</li><li>Develop, enhance and extend automation frameworks</li><li>Identify quality tasks during team sprint cycle and implement automation for new features</li><li>Analyze and communicate test results and defect tracking</li><li>Participate in performance and load test efforts</li><li>Assist in the planning, creation and control of the test environments and test data</li><li>Define test strategy, conduct requirements analysis for testability, identify scope, conduct risk and mitigation planning, configuration management planning, write master and detailed test plans for test planning and design.</li><li>Participate in the review of acceptance test procedures and processes and provide recommendations for improvements to eliminate redundancies in testing and improve efficiency.</li><li>Mentor the team and individuals on best automation practices, design and implementation.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Supervisory Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>None<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p>The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary functions.<p><br></p>The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary functions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Automated Testing framework experience (Cucumber, Selenium, Mocha/Chai, TestNG)</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>Hands-on experience with writing automation test code and utilizing leading industry standards tools and frameworks that can simulate complex multi-system scenarios</li><li>Proficiency with automated testing types (Unit, Functional, Load, Security, Behavioral, Integration, Component, Contract and End to End)</li><li>Experience working with two or more of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, event driven systems, transaction processing systems, distributed and parallel systems, large software systems development, security software development, public-cloud platforms</li><li>Strong testing experience which includes developing test plans, automate test cases, and working with test frameworks.</li><li>Deep analytical skills with ability to describe methods of testing highly sophisticated systems, diagnose systems defects, and clearly communicate to project constituents, key findings and learning.</li><li>Experience working in a SaaS environment</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and team-focused environment.</li><li>Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with object-oriented programming languages (Java, Python, C++, Javascript, R, etc)</li><li>Familiarity with object-oriented design, industry best practices, software patterns, and architecture principles </li><li>Familiarity with automated testing frameworks (Cucumber, TestNG, Selenium, etc) preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education and/or Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field, or equivalent practical experience </li><li>1-3 years’ experience working in an agile software development environment</li><li>Excellent Oral and written communication skills </li><li>Work experience in the capital markets industry preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Certificates or Licenses:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are (must be included with each job posting)</strong><p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>The Options Clearing Corporation (OCC) is the world's largest equity derivatives clearing organization. Founded in 1973, OCC is dedicated to promoting stability and market integrity by delivering clearing and settlement services for options, futures and securities lending transactions. As a Systemically Important Financial Market Utility (SIFMU), OCC operates under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. OCC has more than 100 clearing members and provides central counterparty (CCP) clearing and settlement services to 19 exchanges and trading platforms. More information about OCC is available at www.theocc.com.<p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p>A highly collaborative and supportive environment developed to encourage work-life balance and employee wellness. Some of these components include:<p><br></p>A hybrid work environment, up to 2 days per week of remote work<p><br></p>Tuition Reimbursement to support your continued education<p><br></p>Student Loan Repayment Assistance<p><br></p>Technology Stipend allowing you to use the device of your choice to connect to our network while working remotely<p><br></p>Generous PTO and Parental leave<p><br></p>Competitive health benefits including medical, dental and vision<p><br></p><strong>Step 1<br><br>When you find a position you're interested in, click the 'Apply' button. Please complete the application and attach your resume. <br><br></strong><strong>Step 2<br><br>You will receive an email notification to confirm that we've received your application.<br><br></strong><strong>Step 3<br><br>If you are called in for an interview, a representative from OCC will contact you to set up a date, time, and location. <br><br></strong><strong>For more information about </strong>OCC<strong>, please click </strong>here.<br><br><strong>OCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer</strong>

title: Cloud Platform Engineer - AZURE
description: Job: Salesforce Health Cloud Developer<p><br></p>Location : Chicago, IL (Hybrid)<p><br></p>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.</li><li> Proven experience as a Salesforce Health Cloud Specialist, implementing and configuring Salesforce Health Cloud for healthcare organizations.</li><li> Salesforce Health Cloud Consultant certification is highly desirable.</li><li> Strong understanding of healthcare industry processes, regulations, and standards, such as HIPAA.</li><li> Proficiency in Salesforce Lightning, Apex, Visualforce, and other Salesforce development tools.</li><li> Experience in integrating Salesforce with external systems using APIs, HL7, or FHIR standards.</li><li> Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex business requirements into scalable technical solutions.</li><li> Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.</li><li> Ability to work independently and as part of a team, managing multiple priorities and meeting project deadlines.</li></ul>

title: DevOps Engineer
description: <strong>Are you searching for a rewarding experience helping children and families reach their goals and full potential? If you are passionate about improving the lives of children and adolescents on the autism spectrum, apply now! Key Autism is hiring motivated and passionate professionals, both experienced and entry level to join our growing team! We provide an in-depth ABA training to assist with growth and knowledge of the field and providing impeccable services to our families.<br><br></strong><strong>We are looking for part time Behavior Therapist in LaGrange!<br><br></strong><strong>Hourly payrate is $20 to $26 based on overall experience<br><br></strong><strong><u>Behavior Therapist Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Provide one on one (1:1) in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy</li><li>Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions</li><li>Conduct discrete trials, implement behavior support, and treatment plans</li><li>Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) Supervisor to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy</li><li>Be responsive to the needs and requests of clients, their families and supervisors</li><li>Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work</li><li>Arrive on time and be prepared for therapy sessions<br></li></ul><strong><u>Growth Opportunities In The Field Of ABA<br></u></strong><ul><li>Flexible Schedules </li><li>Competitive hourly rates, incentive programs, and bonuses</li><li>A Rewarding Career: Helping kids achieve their goals!</li><li>Behavior Therapist New-Hire Skills Training </li><li>Tuition discount with our Partners! </li><li>RBT certification and aspiring BCBA program (Supervision and Mentoring)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Behavior Technician Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Education: High School Diploma or Bachelor's Degree (preferred), or RBT</li><li>Experience: Childcare, healthcare, or mental health</li><li>Dependability: Consistency and reliability s crucial for child's success</li><li>Integrity: You will work in the child's home without constant supervision</li><li>Positivity and Patience: It's all about positive reinforcement and repetition</li><li>Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication in English<br></li></ul><strong><u>Physical Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to up to 35lbs. </li><li>Required to perform activities that entail fine and gross motor skills, bend, kneel, and squat, sitting on floor or in a chair, or standing for periods of time. </li><li>Ability to respond quickly in short distance (100 feet) in response to the movement and behaviors of children. </li><li>Willingness and ability to work in both indoor and outdoor settings.<br></li></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>Key Autism provides services to children and adults throughout the states of Massachusetts, Georgia, North Carolina, Florida, Colorado, Illinois, and Texas. Services include programs for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other related conditions. We have been serving families since 2014. At Key we work as compassionate partners with individuals, families, case managers and other professionals to provide the level of support needed to improve the lives of the clients we serve.<br><br>At Key Autism Services, all the autism treatment services we provide are guided by a common philosophy about the role of the family in a child's development. We strive to equip both the children and their families with necessary skills for strong, satisfying relationships with one another, because we know that learning happens best when it happens in the context of playful, reciprocal interactions with life partners.<br><br>We believe family is the foundation for a child's development. Family is the ever-present guiding force in a child's life from the first breath through all the growing-up years. Family doesn't close for the holidays, go on vacation or call it quits at five o'clock. Family remains a persistent presence on a day-in, day-out basis, through all the seasons of the year, through all the years of childhood.<br><br>Our team is committed to helping individuals and their families become self-sufficient and live as independently as their abilities allow. We hire compassionate, highly trained and dedicated individuals who show a passion to contribute their skills to make our client healthier and stronger.<br><br><strong><em>Check out more opportunities we have to offer! </em></strong>https://www.keyautismservices.com/careers/

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: Hi,<p><br></p>We have an immediate opening for our direct client. Please let me know if you will be interested in the below opening.<p><br></p>Location: Glenview, IL (4 Days onsite in Glenview, 1 day Remote)<p><br></p>Duration: Full time<p><br></p><strong>Required Skills:</strong><p><br></p>Junior .Net Developer2-5 Years .Net experience<p><br></p>Angular expereince<p><br></p>Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC))<p><br></p>Knowledge of at least one of the .NET languages (e.g. C#, Visual Basic .NET) and HTML5/CSS3<p><br></p>Familiarity with architecture styles/APIs (REST, RPC)<p><br></p>Understanding of Agile methodologies

title: Axiom Developer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Embedded opportunity?*</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an Embedded Software Engineer who will be responsible for designing and implementing software of Embedded Devices and Systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment for product lines. This Engineer will write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.</li><li>Qualifications: *</li><li>Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, customer service and interpersonal skills</li><li>Knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components</li><li>Basic knowledge of the full software development lifecycle: from business/systems analysis, through requirements gathering and functional specification authoring, to development, testing and delivery.</li><li>Basic ability to troubleshoot issues and make system changes as needed to resolve issue.</li><li>Basic knowledge of computer hardware and software.</li><li>Solid programming experience in C or C++</li><li>Knowledge of computer development software as it relates to embedded systems, such as SQL, VisualBasic, etc.</li><li>Education/Experience:*</li></ul><p><br></p>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or relevant field required<p><br></p><ul><li>Skills:*</li><li>Embedded System</li><li>Embedded C</li><li>Software Testing</li><li>Testing</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5 - 7 years experience</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Associate, Software Engineering: Software Development Test (SDET)
description: <strong><u>Your Impact: </u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland is looking for a talented and passionate Firmware Engineer who wants to make an impact in the medical &amp; educational space. We are seeking an experienced developer who will help us build and enhance tools and applications that are used by thousands of healthcare providers and patients worldwide for the latest in acute and long-term care facilities and the applications used by the educational institutions.<p><br></p><strong><u> What You'll Do: </u></strong><ul><li> Design and buildout firmware for a new generation of Rauland designed hardware SKUs. </li><li> Participate in all aspects of the software development life cycle from requirements review to product verification. </li><li> Create or review:</li><ul><li> System, sub-system and functional requirements </li><li> Software architecture and detailed design documents </li><li> Software verification plans </li><li> Software build and deployment plans. </li></ul><li> Participate in code inspections. </li><li> Work with the assigned software architect to design and code solutions. </li><li> Work with verification and validation engineers to resolve test failures. </li><li> Work with the technical support group to troubleshoot field problems. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u> Do You Have?... </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent. </li><li> At least 5 years development experience in design and implementation of multi-task, event-driven real time embedded development. </li><li> Expertise with development tools for revision control, bug tracking, peer code review, etc. </li><li> Linux kernel development and integration </li><li> Low Level driver development </li><li> Integrating board support packages from RTOS vendors </li><li> Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems </li><li> Developing firmware using an RTOS </li><li> Integrating hardware and firmware </li><li> Codec programming and integration </li><li> Experience reading schematics and data sheets for components. </li><li> Experience using emulators and hardware debugging tools. </li><li> Experience with IAR Workbench or similar embedded IDEs. </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u> Why Us? </u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland, a division of AMETEK, is a business unit in the Measurement, Communications and Technologies division of AMETEK. We are a leader in integrated communications technology, designing and manufacturing Nurse Call Systems for the medical industry and school critical communication systems for the education K-12 market.<p><br></p>Website: www.rauland.com<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary Minimum: Market<p><br></p>Salary Maximum: Market<p><br></p>Incentive: No<p><br></p>Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.<br><br>AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&amp;P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.
