title: Salesforce Health Cloud Developer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p>Design, develop, and evaluate software for embedded systems from concept through production stage, and make modifications as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Embedded Software Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, IL will be responsible for developing software for CNH Industrial’s onboard Electronics Control Units (ECUs) for Precision Agriculture and Construction Equipment products; developing middleware infrastructure software components such as communication stacks and power management stacks for the onboard controllers; participating in system and software vehicle architecture reviews and providing mentorship for junior developers; designing, developing, testing, debugging and implementing operating systems components, software tools, and utilities using best practice software development processes and code; determining systems software design requirements; conferring with management, production, and marketing staff to determine engineering feasibility, cost effectiveness, and customer demand for new and existing software products; coordinating field testing of software products and systems; communicating with vehicle platforms to provide regular updates of software development activities and progress; documenting and demonstrating solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, and diagrams to support problem analysis; developing clear and concise well-structured and documented source code applicable for software re-use across multiple controllers; participating in requirements, design, and source code reviews; maintaining released code, as needed; and identifying and implementing opportunities for software process and development cycle time improvements. May telecommute up to three days a week. Salary: $132,710 - $ 163,300 /year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Electronic Engineering or closely related field plus five years of embedded system development experience. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: 1) working on software applications to support the development of platform and core software; 2) C, C++ for drivers, middleware, application development; 3) designing, developing, testing and implementing operating system components, software tools and utilities; 4) defining system software design requirements; 5) coordinating field testing of software products and systems; 6) maintaining code and releases and developing structured document source code for re-use across other controllers; 7) identifying and implementing software process and development cycle time improvements.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Autism Therapist
description: Description <br><br>Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities<br><ul><li> Design and integrate automated security controls, such as SAST, SCA, etc. into an existing, customized SDLC.</li><li> Work across teams to enforce security controls consistently and reduce existing security debt.</li><li> Direct application teams with onboarding the cloud security requirements; working with vendors to troubleshoot the platform and issues related to such integrations.</li><li> Leverage automated process to mitigate security vulnerabilities in the environment by working with the Application Security team to triage security vulnerabilities</li><li> Contribute to security requirements across cloud applications, provide guidance for cloud security and automation, and ensure that logical security controls are manageable and scalable.</li><li> Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices; conduct research, tests, and execute new techniques that can be reused and applied to SDLC.<br><br></li></ul> Skills, Knowledge &amp; Abilities <br><ul><li> Strong oral and written communication skills in the English language to work effectively with all levels of end users and IT personnel.</li><li> Proven track records of building CI/CD pipelines for both application and infrastructure, with a focus on security.</li><li> Expert knowledge of Cloud Native Engineering (GCP preferred). Experience in cloud security is a strong plus.</li><li> Excellent hands-on experience with securing containers at scale. Any supply chain protection experience is a plus.</li><li> Mastery of automation tools (e.g., Concourse, Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible etc.). GitHub Actions is a plus.</li><li> Hands on experience developing, deploying and maintaining, automated tooling using Python, Go, or similar.</li><li> Comfort with automated, frequent, incremental code testing and deployment as part of a set of mature DevOps practices</li><li> Expert knowledge of both Windows server operating system as well as expertise with one or more various Linux operating systems<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>Devops, Devsecops, Security, Kubernetes, Terraform, Automation, Cicd<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Devops,Devsecops,Security,Kubernetes,Terraform,Automation,Cicd<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Education &amp; Experience<br><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in computer science, or equivalent</li><li> Minimum of 5 years of related work experience<br><br></li></ul> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Junior .Net Developer - Direct client
description: <strong>About This Job</strong><p><br></p><strong> Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Participate in creating MRS, BRS by analysing the requirements. </li><li> Conduct review of user requirements and needs for new software and performs analysis, design, implementation, installation, and training related new software developed and/or acquired. </li><li> Prepare master verification Plan based on DCR, SRS, DMR, UID, Design Document, RMM etc. </li><li> Develop validation [System Level] test cases based on MRS and Verification [Sub system level] test cases based on BRS requirements; Environment test cases based on UID document. </li><li> Participate in the DMR output form based on DCR assessments on regular basis. </li><li> Participate in Preparation of all kinds of traceability's [Test Environment Traceability, Requirement traceability etc] to ensure the 100% coverage. </li><li> Prepare the exploratory test specifications for informal testing. </li><li> Prepare the test environments suitable for informal and formal testing [system preparation, VM's and Citrix enlivenments etc. </li><li> Use management tools like Quality Center, Clear Quest, Req pro for controlling documents and versioning. </li><li> Prepare the verification and validation reports during the informal and formal phases to keep track of engineering and product issues. </li><li> Use several clinical automation tools for the testing like calibration phantoms, water and glass phantoms, DICOM Edit, DICOM Compare, PACS </li><li> Conduct regular internal audits and make sure all documentation and evidence without any deviation. Participate in external audits from the organization for ISO 9001:2015, ISO 13485, FDA, Bsi, IEC 62304, DEKRA etc </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Academic Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p>This position requires, at a minimum, a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, or a combination of education and experience equating to the U.S. equivalent of a Bachelor's degree in one of the aforementioned subjects.<p><br></p>Software Developer

title: Firmware Engineer
description: Description <br><br>Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities<br><ul><li> Design and integrate automated security controls, such as SAST, SCA, etc. into an existing, customized SDLC.</li><li> Work across teams to enforce security controls consistently and reduce existing security debt.</li><li> Direct application teams with onboarding the cloud security requirements; working with vendors to troubleshoot the platform and issues related to such integrations.</li><li> Leverage automated process to mitigate security vulnerabilities in the environment by working with the Application Security team to triage security vulnerabilities</li><li> Contribute to security requirements across CNA cloud applications, provide guidance for cloud security and automation, and ensure that logical security controls are manageable and scalable.</li><li> Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices; conduct research, tests, and execute new techniques that can be reused and applied to SDLC. Skills, Knowledge &amp; Abilities</li><li> Strong oral and written communication skills in the English language to work effectively with all levels of end users and IT personnel.</li><li> Proven track records of building CI/CD pipelines for both application and infrastructure, with a focus on security.</li><li> Expert knowledge of Cloud Native Engineering (GCP preferred). Experience in cloud security is a strong plus.</li><li> Excellent hands-on experience with securing containers at scale. Any supply chain protection experience is a plus.</li><li> Mastery of automation tools (e.g., Concourse, Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible etc.). GitHub Actions is a plus.</li><li> Hands on experience developing, deploying and maintaining, automated tooling using Python, Go, or similar.</li><li> Comfort with automated, frequent, incremental code testing and deployment as part of a set of mature DevOps practices</li><li> Expert knowledge of both Windows server operating system as well as expertise with one or more various Linux operating systems<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>Devops, Devsecops, Security, Kubernetes, Terraform, Automation, Cicd<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Devops,Devsecops,Security,Kubernetes,Terraform,Automation,Cicd<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Education &amp; Experience<br><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in computer science, or equivalent</li><li> Minimum of 5 years of related work experience<br><br></li></ul> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: <strong>About INTERACTIVE BROKERS! </strong><p><br></p><strong> This is a hybrid role (three days in the office/two days remote). </strong><p><br></p>Interactive Brokers Group has been consistently at the forefront of trading innovation , starting with the invention of the first floor-based handheld computer in 1983. We pride ourselves on being primarily a technology company and challenging the status quo. We push boundaries to offer our clients the best trading platform with the most sophisticated features at the lowest cost. Software development is the lifeblood of our firm, and it shows in our stellar brokerage platform. Interactive Brokers is regularly recognized as a leader in the financial services industry .<p><br></p><strong><u>About Your Team</u></strong><p><br></p>The IBKR Marketing programming team designs, creates and maintains the code base stack that supports IBKR websites, CRM and Sales and Marketing support applications and systems.<p><br></p><strong><u>What Are Your Responsibilities Within IBKR</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, and optimize Spring Boot REST services that provide data to multiple web applications. </li><li> Review, maintain and improve the existing code base. </li><li> Write well-designed, tested, and clean code. </li><li> Collaborate with a team of highly competent co-workers in a fast-paced environment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What Required Skill’s You Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or Mathematics </li><li> Minimum 3 years of experience with Spring Boot and related technologies </li><li> Minimum three years of experience as an application developer </li><li> Minimum three years of experience in Java technologies (Java Servlets, JSP, J2EE) </li><li> Minimum one year of experience with Oracle DBMS </li><li> Minimum one year of experience working on Linux </li><li> Strong knowledge or experience with Apache Tomcat is a plus </li><li> Good knowledge of JSON, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and SQL </li><li> Experience with VueJS a plus </li><li> Oracle Java Programmer Certification a plus </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To be successful in this position, you will have the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Self-motivated and able to handle tasks with minimal supervision. </li><li> Superb analytical and problem-solving skills. </li><li> Excellent collaboration and communication (Verbal and written) skills. </li><li> Outstanding organizational and time management skills. </li></ul> <p><br></p><strong><u>Company Benefits &amp; Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive salary, annual performance-based bonus and stock grant </li><li> Retirement plan 401(k) with competitive company match </li><li> Excellent health and welfare benefits, including medical, dental, and vision benefits </li><li> Wellness screenings and assessments, health coaches and counseling services through an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) </li><li> Paid time off and a generous parental leave policy </li><li> Daily company lunch allowance provided, and a fully stocked kitchen with healthy options for breakfast and snack </li><li> Corporate events including team outings, dinners, volunteer activities and company sports teams </li><li> Education reimbursement and learning opportunities </li><li> Modern offices with multi-monitor setups </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Company Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Interactive Brokers LLC, a subsidiary of Interactive Brokers Group, Inc. (Ticker: IBKR) is a direct access electronic broker serving professionals, frequent traders, institutional investors, financial advisors and introducing brokers. Our clients have access to more than 150 market centers around the world from a single integrated account. Our employees are part of a dynamic, multi-national, fast-paced, results-oriented team that has spent four decades focused on advanced technology and automation that equips our clients with a uniquely sophisticated platform to manage their investment portfolios. We provide our clients with advantageous execution prices, risk and portfolio management tools, research facilities and investment products, at low or no cost, positioning them to achieve superior returns.<p><br></p>Headquartered in Greenwich, CT, USA. IBKR has offices in more than 15 countries across the world.<p><br></p>IBKR is a member of NYSE, FINRA, and SIPC. Interactive Brokers Group brokerage affiliates are regulated by securities and commodities agencies around the world.<p><br></p>Click the link to view a short video with a few words from current Interactive Brokers employees: https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=31899

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description: <strong>Developer III</strong><p><br></p><strong>Skill Level:</strong> Mid Level (5-8 yrs exp.)<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>" Design, develop, document, unit test, and debug new Cloud applications utilizing JSON, Java, existing software systems, and large-scale proprietary Cloud backend with EC2, DynamoDB, Microservices, etc. for internal use.<p><br></p>" Serve as a technical expert on development projects.<p><br></p>" Participate in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design.<p><br></p>" Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements.<p><br></p>" Support, maintain, and document software functionality.<p><br></p>" Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation.<p><br></p>" Analyze code to find causes of cyber security vulnerable errors and revise programs as needed.<p><br></p>" Participate in software design meetings and analyze user needs to determine technical requirements.<p><br></p>" Consult with end-users to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs.<p><br></p>" Career-development position within the field.<p><br></p>" Requires high skill sets and developing proficiency within the discipline.<p><br></p>" Conducts tasks and assignments as directed.<p><br></p>" Works under no or minimum supervision with some latitude for independent judgment.<p><br></p>" Typically requires 5-8 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of experience and education.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>" Angular, Node.js, TypeScript, Bootstrap, SCSS, Node.js, npm<p><br></p>" Microservices Development: Java, Spring Integration, Spring Boot, XML, XSD, Spring Kafka, Apache CXF, Restful API, Docker, Kubernetes, FluentD, Prometheus, Helm<p><br></p>" AWS Stack: AWS Amplify CLI, ElasticSearch, AppSynch<p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p>" Bachelors degree in Computer Science required<p><br></p>" Java/AWS certificate preferred<p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: Software Developer (Spring Boot / Web Services)
description: One of the largest health insurers in the nation is focused on continuously building an industry-defining, world-class IT capability. Healthcare is forever evolving, especially due to emerging technologies, making this a great experience to add to your resume. Come join their winning team!<p><br></p>This <strong>Contract </strong> role as a <strong>Hadoop Developer </strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> will be responsible for providing basic design documents and translates into component-level designs to accelerate development. Designs, develops, and distributes reusable technical components. This is a <strong>Hybrid </strong> role.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Participate in sprint planning, design, coding, unit testing, sprint reviews </li><li> Provide basic design documents and translates into component-level designs to accelerate development. Designs, develops, and distributes reusable technical components. </li><li> Assist in developing technical documentation; participate in test-plan development, integration and deployment </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 4-6 years of experience in Big Data development using Hadoop with a good understanding in all phases of software development life cycle. </li><li> Experience using Hadoop Technologies like Hive, Spark, Pig, or Kafka </li><li> Experience using Talend </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits: </strong><p><br></p>Solving IT is pleased to offer a rich benefit plan to our W2 employees. We offer five health plan options and a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&amp;D Insurance, and 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT subsidizes the health and dental premium for the employee.<p><br></p>As you continue to develop your skills and experience, Solving IT will work with your changing preferences to match you with rewarding projects. Our unrivaled reputation for quality is demonstrated through our Inavero Best of Staffing award that was won due to the feedback from our own clients and candidates. We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Hadoop Developer 29392

title: Front End Engineer
description: <strong>About Ascendion</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees.</li><li>Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients.</li><li>Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next. Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life</li><li>We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:</li><li>Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands</li><li>Solve complex problems – and learn new skills</li><li>Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients</li><li>Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience a community of change makers!</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse.</li><li>The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.</li><li>Position Details: </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Client: Airlines</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title: .NET Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 06 months possible extension</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Fully Remote</strong><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Need 5+ years of strong experience in .NET 2.0 to 2.5</li><li>Expertise in Session Key Management, Side Scripting Issue, Single Sign On.</li><li>Proficient in C#, TSQL, ADO.NET, SQL Injections</li><li>Address, understand and fix security bugs (2-3 applications requires fixes)</li><li>Address security vulnerabilities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participate in requirements analysis</li><li>Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture</li><li>Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages</li><li>Test and deploy applications and systems</li><li>Revise, update, refactor and debug code</li><li>Improve existing software</li><li>Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)</li><li>Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support</li></ul>
